translated: uproot confusion about the characteristics of phenomena

translated: and become the abode of the words of omniscience,

analyzed: de dag la ni mgo bos bdag phyag 'tshal // blo zhan rnams kyis ma legs bshad pa yi //

translated: To those who illuminate them with the lampüîΩof the Abhidharmako≈õa,üîΩI pay homage to the master Vasubandhu.

original: sgron ma mdzad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sgron ma mdzad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the one who has composed the treatise.

original: la la dag ni thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab mtha' dag gi don dang / tshig gzung ba'i skal ba yod pa'i ngang tshul can dge ba dag yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: la la dag ni thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab mtha' dag gi don dang / tshig gzung ba'i skal ba yod pa'i ngang tshul can dge ba dag yin du zin kyang /
translated: Some, although they are virtuous and have the fortune to understand the meaning and words of the entire teaching of the Lord of Sages,

original: 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang / shes rab zhan pa la la dag chos mngon pa klags pa'i thos pa tsam gyis skrag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas ma thob pa'i nyams pas yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dang / shes rab zhan pa la la dag chos mngon pa klags pa'i thos pa tsam gyis skrag par 'gyur la /
translated: may be hindered by immediate duties and thus fail to attain it, and some, due to their weak intellect, may be frightened by the mere study of the Abhidharma texts.

original: de dag rtag tu khong du chud par 'dod pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag rtag tu khong du chud par 'dod pa yang yod de /
translated: But they too always wish to comprehend it.

original: de bas na de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to delight them,

original: bdag gis chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgya mtsho la 'jug pa 'di brtsam mo //
analyzed: bdag gis chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgya mtsho la 'jug pa 'di brtsam mo //
translated: I shall compose this treatise on the characteristics of the Abhidharma.

original: 'di ltar bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi dngos po brgyad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi dngos po brgyad de /
translated: Thus, there are eight topics of the Sugatas:

original: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba dang 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: Form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness, space, the cessation due to deliberation, and the cessation not due to deliberation.

original: de la gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so //
translated: Form is twofold: basic and derivative.

original: 'byung ba dag ni bzhi ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni bzhi ste sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams rnams so //
translated: The basic elements are four: earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: khams dag ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan 'dzin pa dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams dag ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan 'dzin pa dang / rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called elements because they maintain and because they are the universal cause of all that is derived.

original: de dag gi rang bzhin ni sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba nyid dag go //
analyzed: de dag gi rang bzhin ni sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba nyid dag go //
translated: Their natures are solidity, liquidity, heat, and motion.

original: las ni rten pa dang sbyor ba dang smin par byed pa dang bskyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: las ni rten pa dang sbyor ba dang smin par byed pa dang bskyod pa dag ste /
translated: Their functions are supporting, cohesion, ripening, and expansion.

original: grangs ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: grangs ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: They are enumerated in this order because of the order of their predominance.

original: de dag ni chen po yang yin la 'byung bar 'gyur bas na 'byung ba chen po dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ni chen po yang yin la 'byung bar 'gyur bas na 'byung ba chen po dag ste /
translated: They are great elements and they originate, thus they are great originations.

original: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: Space is not a great origination.

original: de dag ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la khyab pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi dgos pa dang mi @303a * //
analyzed: de dag ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs la khyab pa'i phyir ro // mi dgos pa dang mi @303a * //
translated: Because they pervade derivative form.

original: nus pa'i phyir bzhi kho na ste khri'i rkang pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nus pa'i phyir bzhi kho na ste khri'i rkang pa bzhin no //
translated: They are four in number because a fifth is neither necessary nor possible, like the four legs of a bed.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang / gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus dang / gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: Derived form is the eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body faculties, form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible objects, and nonindicative form.

original: 'byung ba dag las 'byung bas na 'byung ba las gyur pa ste 'byung ba la brten pa'i don gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag las 'byung bas na 'byung ba las gyur pa ste 'byung ba la brten pa'i don gang yin ba'o //
translated: Derived from the elements means derived from the great elements because it is supported on the elements.

original: de la mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can gzugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can gzugs pa'o //
translated: The eye is the support of eye consciousness and it is the agent that sees form.

original: 'dis ni rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams kyang so sor bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams kyang so sor bstan to //
translated: The other sense-faculties, the ear, nose, tongue and body, are also indicated in the same way.

original: gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te kha dog gi bdag nyid dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te kha dog gi bdag nyid dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Form is of two types: color and shape.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kha dog ngan pa dang dbyibs ngan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis kha dog ngan pa dang dbyibs ngan par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Blessed One said: ‚ÄúThere are bad colors and bad shapes.

original: de la kha dog gi gzugs ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: de la kha dog gi gzugs ni rnam pa bcu gnyis te /
translated: ‚Äù Color is of twelve types:

original: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / sprin dang du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang ; grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang mun pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / sprin dang du ba dang / rdul dang / khug rna dang ; grib ma dang / nyi ma dang / snang ba dang mun pa'o //
translated: blue, yellow, red, white, cloud, smoke, dust, mist, shade, light, brightness and darkness.

original: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / sgang dang gshong ngo //
analyzed: dbyibs ni rnam pa brgyad de ring po dang / thung ngu dang / lham pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / phya le ba dang / phya le ba ma yin pa dang / sgang dang gshong ngo //
translated: Shape is of eight types: long, short, square, round, high, low, even and uneven.

original: de la khug rna ni lho bur ro //
analyzed: de la khug rna ni lho bur ro //
translated: Mist is fog.

original: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od do //
analyzed: snang ba ni zla ba dang skar ma dang me dang sman dang nor bu rnams kyi 'od do //
translated: Light is the radiance of the moon, stars, fire, gems, and medicinal herbs.

original: grib ma ni gang na gzugs dag snang ba'o //
analyzed: grib ma ni gang na gzugs dag snang ba'o //
translated: Shadow is where forms are visible.

original: de las bzlog pa ni mun pa'o //üîΩlham pa ni gru bzhi'o //üîΩdkyil 'khor ni zlum po'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mun pa'o // lham pa ni gru bzhi'o // dkyil 'khor ni zlum po'o //
translated: Darkness is the opposite of that.üîΩLong is that which is larger in one part.üîΩShort is that which is smaller in one part.üîΩRound is that which is full in all parts.

original: phya le ba ni dbyibs mnyam pa'o //üîΩphya le ba ma yin ba ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: phya le ba ni dbyibs mnyam pa'o // phya le ba ma yin ba ni dbyibs mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: Square is that which is full in four parts.

original: lhag ma ni brda phrad par bla bsam bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni brda phrad par bla bsam bshad do //
translated: The rest is understood through implication.

original: rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
analyzed: rnam pa nyi shu po 'di dag mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
translated: These twenty aspects are cognized by visual consciousness and the mental consciousness induced by it.

original: sgra ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: sgra ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Sound is twofold: that of the great elements conjoined and that of the great elements not conjoined.

original: de la lus su gtogs pa rnams ni zin pa dag ste sems pa dang bcas pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lus su gtogs pa rnams ni zin pa dag ste sems pa dang bcas pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, those belonging to the body are conjoined, meaning that which is associated with thought.

original: bzlog pa ni ma zin pa dag go //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ma zin pa dag go //
translated: The opposite is not conjoined.

original: gang snga mas bskyed pa de ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang snga mas bskyed pa de ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: That sound which is produced by the former is produced by the great elements that are appropriated.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: lag pa dang smra ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: lag pa dang smra ba'i sgra'o //
translated: the sound of hands and speech.

original: gang phyi mas bskyed pa de ni ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang phyi mas bskyed pa de ni ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: That sound which is produced by the latter is produced by the great elements that are not appropriated.

original: 'di lta ste rlung dang nags tshal dang 'bab chu'i @303b sgra ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste rlung dang nags tshal dang 'bab chu'i @303b sgra ste ;
translated: For example, the sound of wind, forest, and waterfall.

original: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types of sound: that which is in the domain of sentient beings, that which is not in the domain of sentient beings, that which is both, and that which is neither.

original: 'di lta ste smra ba'i sgra ni sems can du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste smra ba'i sgra ni sems can du ston pa'o //
translated: For example, the sound of speech is in the domain of sentient beings.

original: lhag ma ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The rest is not in the domain of sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang sprul pa'i smra ba'i sgra ni sems can du ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sprul pa'i smra ba'i sgra ni sems can du ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the sound of speech of a magical creation is in the domain of sentient beings.

original: lhag ma ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The rest is not in the domain of sentient beings.

original: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: That is also of eight types, distinguished as pleasant and unpleasant.

original: rnam pa brgyad po de yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad po de yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
translated: These eight types are cognized by the ear consciousness and the mental consciousnesses that are induced by it.

original: dri ni rnam pa gsum ste dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dang dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dri ni rnam pa gsum ste dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba dang dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: Smells are of three types: fragrant, foul, and neutral.

original: dri zhim pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: A fragrant smell is one that expands the great elements that are the sense faculties.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dri nga ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dri nga ba'o //
translated: A foul smell is the opposite of that.

original: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni dri mnyam pa ste rnam pa gsum po 'di yang sna'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni dri mnyam pa ste rnam pa gsum po 'di yang sna'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
translated: A neutral smell is the opposite of both of those. These three types are cognized by the nose consciousness and the mental consciousnesses that are induced by it.

original: ro ni mngar ba dang skyur ba dang / lan tsha dang kha ba dang tsha ba dang bska ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: ro ni mngar ba dang skyur ba dang / lan tsha dang kha ba dang tsha ba dang bska ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug ste /
translated: Tastes are of six types: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: drug po de dag kyang lce'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
analyzed: drug po de dag kyang lce'i rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
translated: These six are cognized by the tongue consciousness and the mental consciousnesses that are induced by it.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: One part of the tangible consists of seven real entities:üîΩsmoothness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang bskres  pa dang skom pa'o //üîΩde la 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste reg tu mi bzod pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid dang / rtsub pa nyid dang lci ba nyid dang yang ba nyid dang / grang ba dang bskres  pa dang skom pa'o // de la 'jam pa ni mnyen pa ste reg tu mi bzod pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Smoothness is softness, the opposite of roughness.

original: rtsub pa ni rud rud po'o //
analyzed: rtsub pa ni rud rud po'o //
translated: Roughness is the opposite of smoothness.

original: lci ba ni gang gis srang gi mgo dma' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lci ba ni gang gis srang gi mgo dma' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Weight is that by which a scale goes down.

original: yang ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: Lightness is the opposite of that.

original: grang ba ni gang gis nyan pas tsha ba 'dod pa'o //üîΩbkres pa ni zas 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: grang ba ni gang gis nyan pas tsha ba 'dod pa'o // bkres pa ni zas 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Cold is that which, when contacted, desires warmth.üîΩHunger is the cause of the desire to eat.

original: skom pa ni 'thung 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skom pa ni 'thung 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Thirst is the cause of the desire to drink.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu gdags par bya ste /
translated: The effect is figuratively designated as the cause,

original: ji skad du sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'byung ba chen po 'dus pa me dang chu'i shas che na 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o // 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa me dang chu'i shas che na 'jam pa'o //
translated: as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe appearance of the Buddhas is happiness.‚ÄùüîΩWhen the great elements of fire and water predominate in the collection, there is smoothness.

original: sa dang rlung gi shas chen rtsub pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang rlung gi shas chen rtsub pa'o //
translated: When the great elements of earth and wind predominate, there is roughness.

original: sa dang chu'i shas chen lci ba'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu'i shas chen lci ba'o //
translated: Heavy is the predominance of earth and water.

original: me dang rlung gi shas chen yang ba'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung gi shas chen yang ba'o //
translated: Light is the predominance of fire and wind.

original: chu dang rlung gi shas che na grang ba'o //
analyzed: chu dang rlung gi shas che na grang ba'o //
translated: Cold is the predominance of water and wind.

original: rlung gi shas chen bkres pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi shas chen bkres pa'o //
translated: Hunger is the predominance of wind.

original: me'i khams kyi shas che na skom ba'o //
analyzed: me'i khams kyi shas che na skom ba'o //
translated: Thirst is the predominance of fire.

original: bdun po de dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / des drangs pa'i yid @304a * //
analyzed: bdun po de dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams ni lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / des drangs pa'i yid @304a * //
translated: These seven and the four great elements are known by the body consciousness and the mental consciousness induced by it.

original: kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
analyzed: kyi rnam par shes pas rnam par rig go //
translated: The other four are known by the mental consciousness alone.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung ba rnam pa tha dad pa dag gis gzhan la rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed do //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung ba rnam pa tha dad pa dag gis gzhan la rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed do //
translated: It is called informative because it informs others through the different elements of mind and mental factors.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la rig par mi byed pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste bram ze ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du de dang 'dra ba la ma yin bar brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la rig par mi byed pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ste bram ze ma yin no zhes bya ba bzhin du de dang 'dra ba la ma yin bar brjod do //
translated: Non-informative is so called because it does not inform others in that way, like a non-Brahmin.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rig byed dang sems dang 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis 'phangs pa rnam par ma g-yengs pa dang / de ma yin pa'i sems dang sems med pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par rig byed dang sems dang 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis 'phangs pa rnam par ma g-yengs pa dang / de ma yin pa'i sems dang sems med pa yang rung ste /

original: de la mtshungs par ldan ba ni sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang mos pa dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bag yod pa dang bag med pa dang skyo ba dang rab tu dga' ba dang ;
analyzed: de la mtshungs par ldan ba ni sems pa dang reg pa dang yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang mos pa dang dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bag yod pa dang bag med pa dang skyo ba dang rab tu dga' ba dang ;
translated: Among them, that which is associated is volition, contact, mental attention, desire to know, resolve, faith, vigor, mindfulness, concentration, discernment, initial inquiry, investigation, heedfulness, heedlessness, remorse, and absence of remorse.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa btang snyoms dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / kun du sbyor ba rnams dang / 'ching ba rnams dang /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang rnam par mi 'tshe ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa btang snyoms dang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang / kun du sbyor ba rnams dang / 'ching ba rnams dang /
translated: pliancy, non-violence, shame, embarrassment, equanimity, roots of virtue, roots of non-virtue, fetters, bonds,

original: phra rgyas rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / kun nas dkris te 'dug pa rnams dang / zag pa rnams dang / chu bo rnams dang / sbyor ba rnams dang / len pa rnams dang / sdud pa rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang /
analyzed: phra rgyas rnams dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang / kun nas dkris te 'dug pa rnams dang / zag pa rnams dang / chu bo rnams dang / sbyor ba rnams dang / len pa rnams dang / sdud pa rnams dang / sgrib pa rnams dang /
translated: latent afflictions, entanglements, outflows, floods, bonds, clingings, obscurations,

original: shes pa rnams dang bzod pa rnams so //üîΩde la gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: shes pa rnams dang bzod pa rnams so // de la gnas dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang dus dang rdzas mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: knowledges, and acceptances.üîΩThey are concomitant with the mind through five similarities: similarity of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.

original: mtshungs pa lnga dag gis sems dang mtshungs par ldan bas de bas na mtshungs par ldan pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa lnga dag gis sems dang mtshungs par ldan bas de bas na mtshungs par ldan pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called concomitant.

original: bzlog pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa dag ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa dag ste /
translated: The opposite of that is non-concomitant.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'thob ba dang 'thob pa med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang ; srog gi dbang po dang / skal pa 'dra ba dang / skye ba dang rga ba dang /
analyzed: 'thob ba dang 'thob pa med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang ; srog gi dbang po dang / skal pa 'dra ba dang / skye ba dang rga ba dang /
translated: attainment and non-attainment, the meditative attainment of non-perception, the meditative attainment of cessation, non-perception, the faculty of life, similarity of lot, birth, aging,

original: gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dang / ming gi tshogs rnams dang / tshig gi tshogs rnams dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid dang / ming gi tshogs rnams dang / tshig gi tshogs rnams dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams te /
translated: duration, impermanence, the groups of names, the groups of words, the groups of letters.

original: de gnyis bsdus nas 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis bsdus nas 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: These two are combined and called the formation aggregate.

original: de bas na drang srong chen pos kyang @306a * //
analyzed: de bas na drang srong chen pos kyang @306a * //
translated: Therefore, the Great Sage also said:

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni chu shing gi phung po lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni chu shing gi phung po lta bu'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The formation aggregate is like a bundle of reeds.

original: de la sems pa ni sems mngon bar 'du byed pa yid kyi las te sems kun du g-yo'o zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems pa ni sems mngon bar 'du byed pa yid kyi las te sems kun du g-yo'o zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, volition is the mental karma that forms the mind, which is the meaning of ‚Äúthe mind moves around. ‚Äù

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du mi ston pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold, according to its division into good, bad, and undefined.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i sems yul la reg par byed pa ste sems las byung ba'i chos 'tsho bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i sems yul la reg par byed pa ste sems las byung ba'i chos 'tsho bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Contact is the mind‚Äôs contact with an object through the union of the sense faculty, the object, and consciousness. It is defined as the support of the mental activities.

original: de yang bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de yang bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold, according to whether it is favorable to the experience of pleasure, pain, or neither.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa gang sems yul rnams la gtod pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyi 'jug pa gang sems yul rnams la gtod pa ste /
translated: Attention is the directing of the mind to an object.

original: sngon myong ba la sogs pa sems pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngon myong ba la sogs pa sems pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is what is meant by the term ‚Äúthought‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúthinking of something previously experienced, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: slob pa'i dang mi slob pa'i dang slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i dang mi slob pa'i dang slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: of the learner, of the post-learner, and of neither the learner nor the post-learner.

original: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag bdun gyi rgyud las byung ba dri ma med pa ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gang zag bdun gyi rgyud las byung ba dri ma med pa ni slob pa'o //
translated: The learner is the seven types of noble beings who arise in the stream of being of the learner.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud las byung ba ni mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rgyud las byung ba ni mi slob pa'o //
translated: That which arises in the continuum of an arhat is the limb of one beyond training.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is associated with impurity is the limb of neither training nor non-training.

original: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'i brtson 'grus kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa ni byed 'dod pa'i brtson 'grus kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ste /
translated: Volition is the limb of effort that is the desire to act.

original: 'di zhes bya ba bya'o snyam pa gang las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba bya'o snyam pa gang las byung ba'o //
translated: It is that from which the thought ‚ÄúI will do this‚Äù arises.

original: mos pa ni sems yul rnams la mos pa ste yul la ma zhum pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni sems yul rnams la mos pa ste yul la ma zhum pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Interest is the limb of mindfulness that is the mind‚Äôs interest in objects, which means that the mind is not discouraged with regard to objects.

original: dad pa ni sems dang ba ste dkon mchog gsum dang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa sems kyi rnyog pa sel bar byed pa'i chos ston te /
analyzed: dad pa ni sems dang ba ste dkon mchog gsum dang rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa sems kyi rnyog pa sel bar byed pa'i chos ston te /
translated: Faith is the limb of concentration that is the clarity of mind, which is the mind‚Äôs confidence in the three jewels and in the relationship between causes and effects. It is a phenomenon that eliminates the turbidity of the mind.

original: dper na chu dang bar byed pa'i nor bu mtsho'i nang du bcug na /
analyzed: dper na chu dang bar byed pa'i nor bu mtsho'i nang du bcug na /
translated: For example, when a jewel that clarifies water is placed in a lake,

original: rdzab kyi rnyog pa thams cad bstsal nas chu gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rdzab kyi rnyog pa thams cad bstsal nas chu gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: it eliminates all the turbidity of the mud and silt and clarifies the water.

original: dad pa'i nor bu sems kyi mtsho las byung bas kyang sems kyi rnyog pa thams cad bsal nas sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang / chos kyi legs par gsungs pa nyid dang / dge 'dun gyi legs par sgrub pa nyid dang / 'di las phyi rol tu gyur pa thams cad 'khrul par byed de /
analyzed: dad pa'i nor bu sems kyi mtsho las byung bas kyang sems kyi rnyog pa thams cad bsal nas sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub dang / chos kyi legs par gsungs pa nyid dang / dge 'dun gyi legs par sgrub pa nyid dang / 'di las phyi rol tu gyur pa thams cad 'khrul par byed de /
translated: It is the faith in the enlightenment of the Buddhas, in the well-spokenness of the Dharma, in the excellent practice of the Sa·πÖgha, and in the dependent origination of all things.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la mngon par dad pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la mngon par dad pa'o //
translated: It is the faith in the true nature of dependent origination.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos skyed pa dang 'gog pa spro ba ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos skyed pa dang 'gog pa spro ba ste /
translated: Vigor is the enthusiasm for producing good and for stopping evil.

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam du bying ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the means of emerging from the mire of cyclic existence.

original: dran pa ni sems kyi @306b mngon par brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: dran pa ni sems kyi @306b mngon par brjod pa nyid de /
translated: Mindfulness is the expression of the mind.

original: byas pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa'i las ma brjed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byas pa dang / bya ba dang / byed pa'i las ma brjed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the non-forgetting of what has been done, what is being done, and what is to be done.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of the mind.

original: sems spre'u lta bu dmigs pa gcig la 'jug ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems spre'u lta bu dmigs pa gcig la 'jug ces bya ba'i don gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression: ‚ÄúThe monkey-like mind is fixed on a single object‚Äù?

original: dper na sbrul 'od ma'i sbubs su bcug na gya gyur mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sbrul 'od ma'i sbubs su bcug na gya gyur mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a snake, when placed in a bamboo joint, cannot twist around,

original: sems ting nge 'dzin gyi sbubs su bcug nas drang srong 'gro'o zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems ting nge 'dzin gyi sbubs su bcug nas drang srong 'gro'o zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: in the same way, when the mind is placed in the bamboo joint of concentration, the sage can go wherever he wants.üîΩThis is the opinion of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Intellect is the discernment of dharmas.

original: chos rnam pa brgyad po de dag gi sdud pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu dang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la ji ltar mthun mthun du rtog pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnam pa brgyad po de dag gi sdud pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang 'bras bu dang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la ji ltar mthun mthun du rtog pa'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of the eight dharmas, i.e., the aggregates, sense-fields, elements, etc., in their general and particular characteristics, as well as the discernment of the aggregates, etc., in their nature as cause and effect.

original: rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Imagination is the gross characteristic of the mind.

original: gnyis su na rtog pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis su na rtog pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: It is also called vikalpa, discrimination.

original: 'du shes kyi rlung gis bskyed na /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rlung gis bskyed na /
translated: When it is produced by the wind of discrimination,

original: 'jug pa rnam par shes pa rtsing ba'i tshogs lnga 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos so //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnam par shes pa rtsing ba'i tshogs lnga 'jug pa'i rgyu'i chos so //
translated: it is the dharma which is the cause of the five sense consciousnesses.

original: dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dpyod pa ni sems zhib pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Discernment has the characteristic of mental subtlety.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa dang mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa dang mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: It is a phenomenon that accompanies mental consciousness.

original: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste /
translated: Carelessness is the non-cultivation of wholesome phenomena.

original: mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the meaning of non-engagement.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ste /
translated: Carefulness is the cultivation of wholesome phenomena.

original: bag med pa las phyir 'jil ba'i chos so //
analyzed: bag med pa las phyir 'jil ba'i chos so //
translated: It is a phenomenon that counteracts carelessness.

original: skyo ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa la rtog pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mthun pa'i chos yid 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: skyo ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa la rtog pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / mthun pa'i chos yid 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Discontent is the characteristic of aversion, which arises from contemplating the faults of cyclic existence and is conducive to freedom from attachment.üîΩIt is a mental factor that, when it arises, causes the mind to be discontented with cyclic existence.

original: sems las byung ba'i chos gang byung na 'khor ba la sems skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dang ldan pas yid 'byung bas yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i chos gang byung na 'khor ba la sems skyo bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dang ldan pas yid 'byung bas yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called mental attention because it is associated with aversion.

original: mchog tu dga' ba ni mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba ni mgu ba dang / rab tu dga' ba ste /
translated: Supreme joy is satisfaction and delight.

original: dge ba'i sems la gnod pa las 'byung bar gnyen po tshol ba can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems la gnod pa las 'byung bar gnyen po tshol ba can no //
translated: It is the seeking of antidotes that arises from the mind being harmed by unwholesome states.

original: de rnyed nas de la yid tshim pa de gang yin pa de ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de rnyed nas de la yid tshim pa de gang yin pa de ni mchog tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The supreme joy is the satisfaction of the mind that has attained that.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do //üîΩrnam par mi 'tshe ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do // rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni /
translated: Calmness is the flexibility of mind.

original: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la mngon par dga' ba dang mi mthun pa'i sems bzang po nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa byed pa la mngon par dga' ba dang mi mthun pa'i sems bzang po nyid de /
translated: Non-violence is the goodness of mind that is incompatible with delighting in harming others.

original: gang gi dbang gis gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o //üîΩngo tsha shes pa ni rigs pa la gzhol ba /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o // ngo tsha shes pa ni rigs pa la gzhol ba /
translated: It is the power by which one does not harm others.

original: bdag dang chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung ba /
analyzed: bdag dang chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung ba /
translated: Shame is the power of the mind that is based on reason, that arises from the consideration of self and Dharma,

original: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i sems kyi dbang ste /üîΩgang gi dbang gis yon tan rnams dang / yon @307a * //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i sems kyi dbang ste / gang gi dbang gis yon tan rnams dang / yon @307a * //
translated: that is incompatible with the cause of craving,

original: tan can rnams la gus pa dang bcas par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tan can rnams la gus pa dang bcas par gnas pa'o //
translated: by which one abides with respect for virtues and those who have virtues.

original: khrel yod pa ni yon tan la goms par byed pa sngon du gtong ba gti mug gi rgyu mthun pa'i dgrar gyur pas chos ngan pa la smod pa ste /
analyzed: khrel yod pa ni yon tan la goms par byed pa sngon du gtong ba gti mug gi rgyu mthun pa'i dgrar gyur pas chos ngan pa la smod pa ste /
translated: Decorum is the condemnation of bad dharmas by one who is accustomed to virtues, who is preceded by shame, and who is incompatible with the cause of delusion.

original: gang yod na kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yod na kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
translated: When it exists, one sees the danger in what is reprehensible.

original: btang snyoms ni mi rigs pa sel ba dang / rigs pa la 'jug par byed pa la btang snyoms su byed pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mi rigs pa sel ba dang / rigs pa la 'jug par byed pa la btang snyoms su byed pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is the state of equanimity in the elimination of what is improper and in the engagement of what is proper.

original: de yod pas sems de mi rigs pa yang mi sel /
analyzed: de yod pas sems de mi rigs pa yang mi sel /
translated: When it exists, the mind does not eliminate what is improper,

original: rigs pa la yang mi 'jug par srang 'dzin pa'i rigs pas mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa la yang mi 'jug par srang 'dzin pa'i rigs pas mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: and it does not engage in what is proper. It is like a scale in equilibrium, remaining in a state of equanimity.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The roots of the wholesome are three:

original: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'o //
translated: non-greed, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: de la ma chags pa ni chags par gyur pa'i gnyen po'i chos so //üîΩzhe sdang med pa ni khong khro ba dang mi mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni chags par gyur pa'i gnyen po'i chos so // zhe sdang med pa ni khong khro ba dang mi mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: Among them, non-greed is the antidote to the state of greed.üîΩNon-hatred is the antidote to the state of anger.

original: gti mug med pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin te mi shes pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos so //
analyzed: gti mug med pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin te mi shes pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos so //
translated: Non-delusion is the antidote to the state of delusion.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyis kyang dge la /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyis kyang dge la /
translated: They are wholesome by their very nature,

original: dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar yang gyur pas na /
analyzed: dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar yang gyur pas na /
translated: and they are the roots of other wholesome states.

original: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
translated: Therefore, the roots of virtue.

original: srid pa yid du 'ong ba dang thar pa'i myu gu mngon par sgrub par byed pas /
analyzed: srid pa yid du 'ong ba dang thar pa'i myu gu mngon par sgrub par byed pas /
translated: Therefore, the roots of virtue are the seeds of pleasant existence and liberation.

original: bde ba'i don ni dge ba'i don to //
analyzed: bde ba'i don ni dge ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpleasant‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúvirtue.‚Äù

original: yang na gzugs bzang po mngon par grub par byed pas legs par lobs pa'i don te /
analyzed: yang na gzugs bzang po mngon par grub par byed pas legs par lobs pa'i don te /
translated: Or, the meaning of ‚Äúwell-practiced‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúvirtue,‚Äù because they produce a good physical form,

original: ri mo mkhan legs par lobs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri mo mkhan legs par lobs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a well-practiced artist.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /üîΩde dag nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste / de dag nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /
translated: There are three roots of nonvirtue:

original: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go //
analyzed: chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug go //
translated: greed, hatred, and delusion, which are the opposites of those.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i srid pa rnam pa lnga ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i srid pa rnam pa lnga ni chags pa'o //
translated: Among them, the five kinds of craving associated with the desire realm are greed.

original: khong khro ba lnga ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba lnga ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: The five kinds of hatred are hatred.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dod par gtogs pa'i ma rig pa rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po gang yin pa de ni gti mug go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i gti mug ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dod par gtogs pa'i ma rig pa rnam pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po gang yin pa de ni gti mug go //
translated: The thirty-four kinds of ignorance associated with the desire realm, except for the ignorance that is associated with the views of the transitory collections and extreme views, is delusion.

original: de dag ni bdag nyid kyis kyang mi dge la /
analyzed: de dag ni bdag nyid kyis kyang mi dge la /
translated: They are nonvirtuous by their very nature.

original: mi dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar yang gyur pas na de'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
analyzed: mi dge ba gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar yang gyur pas na de'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
translated: They are the roots of nonvirtue because they are the roots of the other nonvirtues.

original: srid pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed pas mi bde ba'i don ni mi dge ba'i don to //
analyzed: srid pa yid du mi 'ong ba'i myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed pas mi bde ba'i don ni mi dge ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of nonvirtue is the meaning of misfortune, because they produce the undesirable sprout of existence.

original: yang na gzugs bzang po ma yin pa mngon par 'grub par byed pas /
analyzed: yang na gzugs bzang po ma yin pa mngon par 'grub par byed pas /
translated: Or, they produce an undesirable form.

original: ma lobs pa'i don de snga ma las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ma lobs pa'i don de snga ma las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The meaning of nonvirtue is the opposite of the meaning of well-trained.

original: lung du mi ston pa'i rtsa ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: lung du mi ston pa'i rtsa ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: The roots of indeterminate are four:

original: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa zhes bya ba rnams so//
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa zhes bya ba rnams so//
translated: craving, view, pride, and ignorance.

original: @307b de la dang po ni gzugs dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa'i sred pa rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: @307b de la dang po ni gzugs dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa'i sred pa rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Among them, the first is the ten types of craving belonging to the form and formless realms.

original: gnyis pa ni de na yod pa nyid kyi lta ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de na yod pa nyid kyi lta ba nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis so //
translated: The second is the twenty-four views existing there and the two views of the perishable collection and extreme views belonging to the desire realm.

original: gsum pa ni der gtogs pa nyid kyi nga rgyal rnam pa bcu'o//
analyzed: gsum pa ni der gtogs pa nyid kyi nga rgyal rnam pa bcu'o//
translated: The third is the ten types of pride that are included in that realm.

original: bzhi pa ni de na yod pa'i ma rig pa nyid dang / 'di na yod pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni de na yod pa'i ma rig pa nyid dang / 'di na yod pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa gnyis so //
translated: The fourth is the ignorance that exists in that realm and the two ignorances that exist here, namely, the ignorance associated with the afflicted view of the self and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme.

original: bzhi po de dag ni lung du mi ston pa'i rtsa ba rnams su 'dod do //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni lung du mi ston pa'i rtsa ba rnams su 'dod do //
translated: These four are considered the roots of indeterminate actions.

original: bsam gtan gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: Because of the three contemplations.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa gsum ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa gsum ni /
translated: In fact, there are three contemplations:

original: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
translated: contemplation that is dominated by craving, contemplation that is dominated by afflicted view, and contemplation that is dominated by pride.

original: de dag ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'byung ngo //
translated: These arise through the power of ignorance.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don du lung bstan du med pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i don du lung bstan du med pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par mi byed pa ste /
translated: They are not declared to be virtuous or nonvirtuous, and they do not produce pleasant or unpleasant results.

original: de dag ni rtsa ba yang yin la lung du mi ston pa gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar yang gyur pas lung du mi ston pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni rtsa ba yang yin la lung du mi ston pa gzhan rnams kyi rtsa bar yang gyur pas lung du mi ston pa rnams so //
translated: They are roots and the roots of other neutral states.

original: kun du sbyor ba ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine fetters:üîΩattachment, hostility, conceit, ignorance, view, extreme view, adherence to mere rules and rituals,

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang phrag dog dang / ser sna zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang phrag dog dang / ser sna zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: hostility, and envy and avarice.

original: de la khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags /
analyzed: de la khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags /
translated: Among them, attachment is the desire and passion for the three realms.

original: chags pa'i mtshan nyid rgya skyegs zhu ba 'byar ba lta bu'i chos kyi rjes su ma chags pa ste /
analyzed: chags pa'i mtshan nyid rgya skyegs zhu ba 'byar ba lta bu'i chos kyi rjes su ma chags pa ste /
translated: It is the non-abandonment of the Dharma of attachment, which is like the spreading of red lac.

original: rjes su chags pa nyid kun du sbyor bas rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa nyid kun du sbyor bas rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is a fetter because it is a fetter through attachment.

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems /
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems /
translated: Hostility is the malice that torments sentient beings.

original: gnod sems kyi mtshan nyid rtsa ba'i sa bon lta bu'i chos ni khong khro ba ste ;
analyzed: gnod sems kyi mtshan nyid rtsa ba'i sa bon lta bu'i chos ni khong khro ba ste ;
translated: It is the non-abandonment of the Dharma of hostility, which is like a root.

original: khro ba nyid kun du sbyor bas khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: khro ba nyid kun du sbyor bas khong khro ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Anger is the fetter of wrath.

original: bdag dang gzhan la dmigs nas sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid skyes bu rengs pa lta bu'i chos ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la dmigs nas sems khengs pa'i mtshan nyid skyes bu rengs pa lta bu'i chos ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride is the stiffening of the mind which occurs when one considers oneself and others in terms of the four opinions.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: It is of seven types:üîΩpride, excessive pride,üîΩthe pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am,‚ÄùüîΩthe pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am this,‚ÄùüîΩthe pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am superior,‚ÄùüîΩthe pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am a little inferior,‚Äù

original: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: and false pride.üîΩPride is the stiffening of the mind which occurs when one considers oneself superior to others in terms of caste, family, body,

original: de la nga rgyal ni chung ngu bas bdag rus dang rigs dang gzugs dang / nor dang thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzo la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa 'am /üîΩrus la @308a * //
analyzed: de la nga rgyal ni chung ngu bas bdag rus dang rigs dang gzugs dang / nor dang thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzo la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa 'am / rus la @308a * //
translated: wealth, learning, morality,

original: sogs pa 'dra ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems de ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa 'dra ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems de ni nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: arts, etc., or when one considers oneself equal to those one‚Äôs equal.

original: che ba'i nga rgyal ni mtshungs pa bas bdag rus la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa 'am /üîΩche ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: che ba'i nga rgyal ni mtshungs pa bas bdag rus la sogs pa dag gis bye brag tu 'phags pa 'am / che ba dang mtshungs so snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa ni che ba'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Pride of superiority is the inflation of mind drawn from thinking that one is superior to one's equals in terms of family and so on, or that one is their equal.üîΩPride of thinking i is the inflation of mind drawn from thinking i am.

original: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni che ba bas kyang bdag ches che lo snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal ni che ba bas kyang bdag ches che lo snyam pa des drangs pa'i sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Pride of thinking i am is the inflation of mind drawn from thinking i am great in comparison to those who are greater than i.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bdag tu lta ba'i rjes las byung ba'i sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni bdag tu lta ba'i rjes las byung ba'i sems khengs pa'o //
translated: Pride of thinking i am is the inflation of mind that arises from the view of the transitory composite.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob pa bdag gis thob po snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi rlom sems so //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa gong ma'i khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob pa bdag gis thob po snyam pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i sems kyi rlom sems so //
translated: Arrogance is the mental exaltation that arises from the cause of thinking i have attained the result of stream enterer and so on, when one has not attained it.

original: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs la sogs pa khyad ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung bar lta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal ni rigs la sogs pa khyad ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung bar lta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
translated: The pride of thinking I am a little bit is to think I am a little bit inferior to those who are very superior in caste and so on, and to be conceited by that.

original: log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan yang bdag yon tan dang ldan par lta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan yang bdag yon tan dang ldan par lta zhing des rlom sems pa'o //
translated: The false pride is to think I have good qualities even though one does not have them, and to be conceited by that.

original: nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal bdun po 'di dag ni nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These seven kinds of pride are called the fetter of pride.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid long ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid long ba lta bu ste /
translated: As for ignorance, it is the non-knowing of the three realms, characterized by non-comprehension and blindness.

original: rig pa'i gnyen po ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnyen po ni ma rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The antidote to knowledge is called ignorance.

original: dgag pa ni gnyen po la gzhag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dgag pa ni gnyen po la gzhag pa'i phyir //
translated: The negation is because it is based on the antidote,

original: mi mdza' ba dang mi bden pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba dang mi bden pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like not a friend and not true and so on.

original: ma rig pa nyid kun du sbyor bas na ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid kun du sbyor bas na ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Since ignorance itself is a fetter, it is the fetter of ignorance.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba gsum ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba gsum ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The three views of the perishing aggregates, of holding a view as paramount, and of wrong views are the fetters of views.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag med pa bdag gi med pa rnams la /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag med pa bdag gi med pa rnams la /
translated: Among them, the afflicted view of the perishing aggregates is the afflicted understanding that grasps the five aggregates of clinging, which are devoid of self and mine,

original: bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa /
translated: as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //üîΩde ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs so //üîΩde lta bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o // de ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs so // de lta bas na 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of holding a view as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps the view that is held as paramount,

original: chad pa ma yin rtag pa ma yin pa de dag nyid la ;
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag pa ma yin pa de dag nyid la ;
translated: as being paramount, as being the best, as being exalted, and as being supreme.üîΩThe view of holding a code of conduct and ritual as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a code of conduct and ritual as being pure, as being liberation, and as being exalted.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni mthar 'dzin par lta ste /
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo ni mthar 'dzin par lta ste /
translated: The view of holding a view as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a view as being paramount, as being the best, as being exalted, and as being supreme.üîΩThe view of holding a code of conduct and ritual as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a code of conduct and ritual as being pure, as being liberation, and as being exalted.

original: mtha' gnyis su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of holding a view as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a view as being paramount, as being the best, as being exalted, and as being supreme.üîΩThe view of holding a code of conduct and ritual as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a code of conduct and ritual as being pure, as being liberation, and as being exalted.üîΩThe view of holding a view as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a view as being paramount, as being the best, as being exalted, and as being supreme.üîΩThe view of holding a code of conduct and ritual as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a code of conduct and ritual as being pure, as being liberation, and as being exalted.

original: las med do las kyi 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: las med do las kyi 'bras bu med do //
translated: The view of holding a view as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a view as being paramount, as being the best, as being exalted, and as being supreme.

original: thar pa med do //
analyzed: thar pa med do //
translated: The view of holding a code of conduct and ritual as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a code of conduct and ritual as being pure, as being liberation, and as being exalted.üîΩThe view of holding a view as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a view as being paramount, as being the best, as being exalted, and as being supreme.üîΩThe view of holding a code of conduct and ritual as paramount is the afflicted understanding that grasps a code of conduct and

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam yang med do snyam du de ltar dngos po yang yang dag par @308b 'jig par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam yang med do snyam du de ltar dngos po yang yang dag par @308b 'jig par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa can gyi blo gang yin pa de ni log par lta ba'o //
translated: The thought that there is no path to attain it is a defiled cognition that engages in the complete destruction of entities.

original: lta ba gsum po de dag ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba gsum po de dag ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: These three views are the fetter of views.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis so //üîΩlta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis so // lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni /
translated: There are two types of grasping at superiorities.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o//üîΩde la lta ba mchog ma yin pa de dag dang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mchog ma yin pa rnams la /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o// de la lta ba mchog ma yin pa de dag dang / nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mchog ma yin pa rnams la /
translated: The fetter of grasping at superiorities consists of the two: grasping at the superiority of views and grasping at the superiority of morality and ritual.üîΩThe thought that those views and the five appropriated aggregates that are not superior are superior is grasping at the superiority of views.

original: mchog snyam du mchog 'dzin pa'i blo'i bye brag gang yin pa de ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: mchog snyam du mchog 'dzin pa'i blo'i bye brag gang yin pa de ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: It is a specific type of cognition that thinks that those views and the five appropriated aggregates that are not superior are superior.

original: rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the term realization.

original: tshul khrims ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims spangs pa'o ;
analyzed: tshul khrims ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims spangs pa'o ;
translated: Morality is the abandonment of immorality.

original: / brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ri dags dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / gcer bu dang thal ba'i nang na nyal ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang 'bab stegs su 'khru ba dang / 'bras bu dang rtsa ba za ba dang ral ba thogs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / brtul zhugs ni khyi dang ri dags dang / ba lang gi brtul zhugs dang / gcer bu dang thal ba'i nang na nyal ba dang / skra 'bal ba dang 'bab stegs su 'khru ba dang / 'bras bu dang rtsa ba za ba dang ral ba thogs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Asceticism is the practice of dogs, deer, and cows; nakedness; sleeping in ashes; pulling out one's hair; bathing at fords; eating fruits and roots; wearing twisted locks, and so on.

original: dag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa /üîΩde gnyi ga la dag par yid ches pa'i blo'i bye brag / bram ze cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa lta bu'i chos gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dag pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa / de gnyi ga la dag par yid ches pa'i blo'i bye brag / bram ze cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa lta bu'i chos gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is not pure.üîΩThe belief in the purity of both of these is the notion of purity.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The belief in the supremacy of morality and asceticism is the belief in the supremacy of any doctrine, such as the purity of the Brahmins who desire ritual purity.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis po de dag ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis po de dag ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: These two beliefs in supremacy are the fetter of belief in supremacy.

original: the tshom ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang ; 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba /
analyzed: the tshom ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang ; 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba bden pa rnams la yid gnyis za ba /
translated: Doubt is the state of two-mindedness with regard to the truths, namely, suffering, origination, cessation, and the path.

original: lam kha brag dang rtsa mi 'dra ba'i chos yin te /
analyzed: lam kha brag dang rtsa mi 'dra ba'i chos yin te /
translated: The path is a doctrine that is not like a forked road.

original: 'di sdug bsngal yin nam 'di sdug bsngal ma yin snyam pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩthe tshom nyid kun du sbyor bas /
analyzed: 'di sdug bsngal yin nam 'di sdug bsngal ma yin snyam pa la sogs pa'o // the tshom nyid kun du sbyor bas /
translated: One thinks, Is this suffering? Is this not suffering? and so on.üîΩDoubt itself is a fetter.

original: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is the fetter of doubt.

original: phrag dog ni pha rol du 'byor ba la mi bzod pa ste /üîΩpha rol po nor dang ldan nam mkha' nas bkur ba rnams la /
analyzed: phrag dog ni pha rol du 'byor ba la mi bzod pa ste / pha rol po nor dang ldan nam mkha' nas bkur ba rnams la /

original: sems khong nas 'khrug pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems khong nas 'khrug pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the agitation of the mind that occurs when one thinks, How is it that others possess wealth and honor?

original: phrag dog nyid kun du sbyor bas phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: phrag dog nyid kun du sbyor bas phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Envy itself is a fetter. Thus, it is the fetter of envy.

original: dngos po 'di bdag las gzhan la mi gtong ngo snyam pa'i sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de na ser sna ste /
analyzed: dngos po 'di bdag las gzhan la mi gtong ngo snyam pa'i sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de na ser sna ste /
translated: Avarice is the grasping of things with a mind that thinks, ‚ÄúI will not give this thing to anyone else.‚Äù

original: de nyid kun du sbyor bas ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kun du sbyor bas ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Avarice itself is a fetter. Thus, it is the fetter of avarice.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni 'ching ba'i don te /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni 'ching ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of fetter is the meaning of bondage.

original: ji skad du 'jig rten mgon pos kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jig rten mgon pos kyang /
translated: As the LokƒÅtƒ´tastava says:

original: mig gzugs rnams la kun du mi sbyor la /
analyzed: mig gzugs rnams la kun du mi sbyor la /
translated: The eye is not fettered by forms,

original: gzugs rnams kyang mig la ma yin mod kyi /üîΩde la 'dod pa la @309a * //
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyang mig la ma yin mod kyi / de la 'dod pa la @309a * //
translated: Forms are not the eye,

original: 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dir kun du sbyor ba ste /üîΩdper na ba lang nag po yang ba lang dkar po la kun du mi sbyor la /
analyzed: 'dod chags gang yin pa de ni 'dir kun du sbyor ba ste / dper na ba lang nag po yang ba lang dkar po la kun du mi sbyor la /
translated: but attachment to desire realm objects is a fetter here.üîΩFor example, a black cow is not fettered to a white cow,

original: ba lang dkar po yang ba lang nag po la ma yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang dkar po yang ba lang nag po la ma yin no zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: nor is a white cow fettered to a black cow.

original: kun du sbyor ba rnams ni 'ching ba'i don yin la /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba rnams ni 'ching ba'i don yin la /
translated: The meaning of fetter is bondage.

original: kun du sbyor ba gang dag yin pa de dag 'ching ba la yang yin mod kyi 'on kyang gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gang dag yin pa de dag 'ching ba la yang yin mod kyi 'on kyang gtso bor gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Although all fetters are bonds, the three bonds are stated because they are principal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mdo las /
translated: The TathƒÅgata said in the s≈´tras:

original: 'dod chags ni 'ching ba /üîΩzhe sdang ni 'ching ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'ching ba / zhe sdang ni 'ching ba /
translated: Attachment is a bond.üîΩAversion is a bond.

original: gti mug ni 'ching ba zhes 'ching ba gsum gsungs te /
analyzed: gti mug ni 'ching ba zhes 'ching ba gsum gsungs te /
translated: Delusion is a bond.

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of these have already been explained.

original: phra rgyas ni bdun te /
analyzed: phra rgyas ni bdun te /
translated: There are seven negative tendencies.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / sred pa'i 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang lta ba dang the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / sred pa'i 'dod chags dang / nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang lta ba dang the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: Desire realm attachment, anger, craving attachment, pride, ignorance, afflicted view, and doubt are the proclivities.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni kun du sbyor pa bsam pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni kun du sbyor pa bsam pa'i skabs su bshad zin to //
translated: Their characteristics have already been explained in the chapter on fetters.

original: khams dang tshul dang rnam pa'i bye brag de dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: khams dang tshul dang rnam pa'i bye brag de dbye bar bya'o //
translated: The distinctions of realm, type, and aspect should be analyzed.

original: de la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnams la 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Desire realm attachment is attachment to the desire realm.

original: de nyid phra rgyas yin pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: de nyid phra rgyas yin pas 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
translated: Since that is a proclivity, it is the proclivity of attachment to the desire realm.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'dod chags sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //

translated: Attachment belonging to the desire realm that is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and by the path of meditation is the proclivity of attachment to the desire realm.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khong khro ba lnga ni khong khro ba'i phra rgyas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khong khro ba lnga ni khong khro ba'i phra rgyas so //
translated: The five residues of anger are the anger to be abandoned by seeing the truths of stress, etc., and by the path of meditation.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags bcu po sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags bcu po sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas so //
translated: The ten residues of craving for existence are the craving for the realms of form and formlessness to be abandoned by seeing the truths of stress, etc., and by the path of meditation.

original: nang du ba ltas par gyur pa dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams la thar par 'du shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyed pa'i 'dod chags so zhes bde bar gshegs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: nang du ba ltas par gyur pa dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams la thar par 'du shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyed pa'i 'dod chags so zhes bde bar gshegs pas gsungs so //
translated: The Well Gone One has said that the craving that arises in the two realms is craving for existence, in order to counteract the notion that the realms of form and formlessness are liberation, since one is attached to the pleasure of meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum pa'i nga rgyal bco lnga /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum pa'i nga rgyal bco lnga /
