original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: which are the pride to be abandoned by seeing the truths of stress, etc., and by the path of meditation.

original: ma rig pa'i phra rgyas kyang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phra rgyas kyang de bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The residues of ignorance should be understood in the same way.

original: khams gsum pa'i lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas te /
translated: The thirty six afflicted views of the three realms are the negative tendencies of afflicted view.

original: de las 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'jig tshogs @309b la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: de las 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'jig tshogs @309b la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Among them, the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, clinging to those views as paramount and clinging to rules and ritual as paramount that are associated with the desire realm,

original: rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / lam mthong bas spang par bya ba'i log par lta ba dang /
analyzed: rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / lam mthong bas spang par bya ba'i log par lta ba dang /
translated: wrong view, clinging to those views as paramount and clinging to rules and ritual as paramount that are abandoned by seeing the cause, wrong view and clinging to those views as paramount that are abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation and wrong view,

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de dag ni lta ba bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de dag ni lta ba bcu gnyis so //
translated: clinging to those views as paramount and clinging to rules and ritual as paramount that are abandoned by seeing the truth of path are the twelve views.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: So too, there are twelve in the form realm and twelve in the formless realm.

original: lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po de dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas so //
analyzed: lta ba sum cu rtsa drug po de dag ni lta ba'i phra rgyas so //
translated: These thirty-six views are the proclivities of views.

original: khams kyi the tshom bcu gnyis ni /
analyzed: khams kyi the tshom bcu gnyis ni /
translated: The twelve doubts of the realms

original: the tshom gyi phra rgyas te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi phra rgyas te /
translated: are the proclivities of doubt.

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag go ;
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / de bzhin du gzugs dang gzugs med pa dag go ;
translated: There are four proclivities of doubt in the desire realm that are abandoned by the path of seeing, such as doubt about suffering, and so on. Similarly, there are those in the form and formless realms.

original: /'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: /'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dag ni rnam pa tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The proclivities of attachment and anger of the desire realm are different in type,

original: khams kyis ma yin tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: khams kyis ma yin tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: but not in realm and not in mode.

original: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas na /
analyzed: srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas na /
translated: The proclivity of attachment to existence

original: khams dang rnam pa ste tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: khams dang rnam pa ste tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: is different in realm and type, but not in mode.

original: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas kyang khams dang rnam pa ste tshul gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas kyang khams dang rnam pa ste tshul gyis ma yin no //
translated: The proclivities of pride, ignorance, and doubt are different in realm and type, but not in mode.

original: lta ba'i phra rgyas ni khams dang rnam pa dang tshul gyi bye brag gis tha dad do //
analyzed: lta ba'i phra rgyas ni khams dang rnam pa dang tshul gyi bye brag gis tha dad do //
translated: The proclivities of view are different in realm, type, and mode.

original: de la lta ba rnams kyi khams dang rnam pa'i bye brag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de la lta ba rnams kyi khams dang rnam pa'i bye brag ni bshad zin to //
translated: The specific realms and modes of the views have already been explained.

original: tshul gyi bye brag ni ma bshad de de brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul gyi bye brag ni ma bshad de de brjod par bya'o //
translated: The specific modes have not yet been explained, so they will be explained.

original: de la bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag dang bdag gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'o //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the mode of engaging in the belief in a self and what belongs to a self.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba'o //

analyzed: med pa'i tshul gyis lta ba ni log par lta ba'o // mchog gi tshul gyis zhugs pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //

original: dag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i tshul gyis zhugs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view grasping mere faith and rituals as supreme is the mode of engaging in the view of the supremacy of rules and ritual.

original: phra rgyas ni don ni phra ba'i don to //
analyzed: phra rgyas ni don ni phra ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of negative tendency is subtle.

original: yang na lus dang sems kyi rgyun gyi rjes su bsnyags pa ste /
analyzed: yang na lus dang sems kyi rgyun gyi rjes su bsnyags pa ste /
translated: Or they are negative tendencies because they pursue the continuum of body and mind.

original: chu na rgyu bas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i grib ma bsnyags pa lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so //
analyzed: chu na rgyu bas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i grib ma bsnyags pa lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so //
translated: They are negative tendencies because they pursue the shadow of the mind in the sky, like a water animal pursuing a shadow in the sky.

original: yang na rjes su zhugs pa ste til rnams til mar lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so//
analyzed: yang na rjes su zhugs pa ste til rnams til mar lta bu'i phyir phra rgyas so//
translated: Or they are negative tendencies because they are subtle anu≈õaya and they increase aupacayika.

original: @310a * // yang na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rgyas par 'gyur bas phra rgyas so //
analyzed: @310a * // yang na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams la dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rgyas par 'gyur bas phra rgyas so //
translated: Or they are negative tendencies because they increase by means of the two, possessing the focal object and possessing the concomitant.

original: ci'i phyir rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why do they increase?

original: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis brtag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis brtag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They increase by means of the two, possessing the focal object and possessing the concomitant.

original: de ltar phra rgyas bdun po /
analyzed: de ltar phra rgyas bdun po /
translated: Thus the seven negative tendencies

original: khams dang tshul dang / rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de dag brgyad cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams dang tshul dang / rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de dag brgyad cu rtsa brgyad du 'gyur te /
translated: are differentiated by realm, type and aspect and they become eighty eight.

original: 'dod pa na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
translated: Ten are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa'o //
translated: The afflicted view of the self, extreme view, false view, esteeming a bad view, esteeming morality and ascetic practices, doubt, desire, hatred, pride and ignorance.

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun te /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun te /
translated: Seven are to be abandoned by insight into the origin:

original: de dag gi nang nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa rnams so //
translated: the same as the above, except for the afflicted view of the self, extreme view and esteeming of morality and ascetic practices.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun te de dag nyid do //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun te de dag nyid do //
translated: Seven are to be abandoned by insight into cessation: the same as the above.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad de bdun po de dag nyid dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba brgyad de bdun po de dag nyid dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Eight are to be abandoned by insight into the path: the same as the above, plus esteeming of morality and ascetic practices.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba bzhi ste /
translated: Four are to be abandoned by cultivation:

original: lta ba rnams dang / the tshom ma gtogs so //
analyzed: lta ba rnams dang / the tshom ma gtogs so //
translated: except for the views and doubt.

original: de ltar de dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni 'dod par gtogs pa'i phra rgyas sum cu rtsa drug go //
translated: Thus, there are thirty-six anu≈õayas in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs kyi khams rnams na ni de dag nyid las khong khro ba lnga ma gtogs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams rnams na ni de dag nyid las khong khro ba lnga ma gtogs so //
translated: In the realm of form, there are the same anu≈õayas, with the exception of the five hostile anu≈õayas.

original: gzugs med pa rnams na yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams na yang de bzhin te /
translated: In the formless realm, there are the same anu≈õayas.

original: de dag ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin no //üîΩde la de dag gcig tu bsdus na brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yin no // de la de dag gcig tu bsdus na brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, there are ninety-eight anu≈õayas in all.

original: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, eighty-eight are to be abandoned by the path of insight, and ten are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: khams khams kyi sdug bsngal dang rgyu mthong bas spang bar phya ba'i lta ba dang / the tshom dang dgu dang de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / de dag ni kun du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khams khams kyi sdug bsngal dang rgyu mthong bas spang bar phya ba'i lta ba dang / the tshom dang dgu dang de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang / de dag ni kun du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The nine anu≈õayas that are to be abandoned by insight into the truth of unsatisfactoriness and the origin of unsatisfactoriness in each of the three realms, plus the ignorance associated with them, plus the independent ignorance, are called pervasive.

original: lhag ma rnams ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The others are not pervasive.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i @310b ma rig pa dang / de dag ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang / de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i @310b ma rig pa dang / de dag ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: So too, wrong view, doubt, ignorance concomitant with those, and independent ignorance to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path focus on uncontaminated states.

original: 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa dang / de gnyis kyang zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa dang / de gnyis kyang zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They focus on cessation and path and those two are uncontaminated.

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o //üîΩde la gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de dag ni dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa'o // de la gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa de dag ni dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The remaining views focus on contaminated states.üîΩThose that focus on contaminated states are increased by both possessing objects and possessing concomitant states.

original: gang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag ni ldan pa ste rang gi tshogs rnams so //
analyzed: gang zag pa med pa la dmigs pa de dag ni ldan pa ste rang gi tshogs rnams so //
translated: Those that focus on uncontaminated states are increased by possessing concomitant states alone.

original: de bzhin du khams khams kyi 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa 'ba' zhig dang / de dag ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams khams kyi 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i log par lta ba dang / the tshom dang de dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang / ma rig pa 'ba' zhig dang / de dag ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the false views, doubts, and ignorance associated with the cessation of the realm of desire that are to be abandoned by the path of insight into the truths, and the ignorance that is not associated with the other three, are all focused on the unconditioned.

original: lhag ma rnams ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The remaining ten are focused on the conditioned.

original: de dag byung ba'i go rims ni dang po kho nar /
analyzed: de dag byung ba'i go rims ni dang po kho nar /
translated: The order in which they occur is as follows:

original: ma rig pa dang ldan pas sems can bden pa rnams rmongs te /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ldan pas sems can bden pa rnams rmongs te /
translated: First, the sentient beings who are endowed with ignorance are confused about the truths.

original: de rnams sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar dag mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de rnams sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar dag mi 'dod do //
translated: They do not desire the truth of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, or the path of cessation.

original: de glen pa rnams yang dag pa dang / log pa'i phyogs gnyis thos nas 'di sdug bsngal yin nam //
analyzed: de glen pa rnams yang dag pa dang / log pa'i phyogs gnyis thos nas 'di sdug bsngal yin nam //
translated: The ignorant, having heard the correct and incorrect positions, give rise to doubt, thinking, Is this the truth of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal ma yin snyam pa la sogs pa'i the tshom skye'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin snyam pa la sogs pa'i the tshom skye'o //
translated: Is it not the truth of suffering?

original: de nas dam pa'i blos dam pa ma yin pa dang / bsnyen nas log par thos pa dang / log par sems pas log par nges par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas dam pa'i blos dam pa ma yin pa dang / bsnyen nas log par thos pa dang / log par sems pas log par nges par 'byung ste /
translated: Then, with a false understanding, having approached a false teacher, having heard false doctrines, and having reflected falsely, they form a false certainty.

original: sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa med do //
translated: They say, There is no giving.

original: mchod sbyin med do snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin med do snyam pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The view of annihilation is the belief that there is no sacrifice, etc.

original: de nas log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung ste des nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la sdug bsngal bsal bar bdag tu mngon bar zhen to //
analyzed: de nas log par lta ba las 'jig tshogs la lta ba 'byung ste des nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po rnams la sdug bsngal bsal bar bdag tu mngon bar zhen to //
translated: Then, from the false view, the view of the transitory aggregates arises, which adheres to the five aggregates of attachment as constituting a self, in order to dispel suffering.

original: de las mthar 'dzin bar lta ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las mthar 'dzin bar lta ba 'byung ste /
translated: From that, the extreme view arises.

original: des bdag chad pa 'am rtag par mtha' gnyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bdag chad pa 'am rtag par mtha' gnyis bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, one grasps the two extremes of annihilation or permanence.

original: mthar 'dzin pa las tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa las tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From the extreme view, the esteeming of views and the esteeming of morality and asceticism arise.

original: mthar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis dag par yid ches so //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis dag par yid ches so //
translated: One believes in purification through that very extreme view.

original: de las kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, the overesteeming of morality and asceticism arises.

original: gang gis dag par yid ches pa de la mchog tu 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang gis dag par yid ches pa de la mchog tu 'dzin to //
translated: One esteems that by which one believes in purification.

original: de'i 'og tu rang gi lta ba la 'dod chags skye'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rang gi lta ba la 'dod chags skye'o //
translated: After that, attachment to one's own view arises.

original: lta ba de nyid kyis kyang rlom sems su byed cing pha rol gyi lta ba la 'am /
analyzed: lta ba de nyid kyis kyang rlom sems su byed cing pha rol gyi lta ba la 'am /
translated: One becomes conceited through that very view and despises the views of others.

original: rang gi rgyud kyis sngon bzung ba las btang ba dag la zhe sdang skyes te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyis sngon bzung ba las btang ba dag la zhe sdang skyes te /
translated: Hatred arises from the loss of those previously held by one's own continuum.

original: de dag gi go rims ni de @311a * //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni de @311a * //
translated: Their order is thus.

original: lta'o // nyon mongs pa re re yang rgyu gsum gsum las skyes te /
analyzed: lta'o // nyon mongs pa re re yang rgyu gsum gsum las skyes te /
translated: Each of the afflictions arises from three causes.

original: gal te phra rgyas ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / yul nye bar gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phra rgyas ma spangs pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang / yul nye bar gnas par gyur na /
translated: If the proclivity is not abandoned, if there is incorrect mental attention, and if the object is present,

original: rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs de dag las nyon mongs pa skye'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs de dag las nyon mongs pa skye'o //
translated: the affliction arises from the power of cause, object, and application.

original: de dag ni lus dang sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni lus dang sems kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pas nyon mongs pa rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: They are called afflictions because they afflict the continuum of body and mind.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams gang yin pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa yang yin no //
translated: Those that are afflictions are also secondary afflictions.

original: gang dag de rnams las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag de rnams las gzhan pa sems las byung ba'i chos nyon mongs pa can 'du byed kyi phung por bsdus pa de dag ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid do //
translated: Those that are other than those, that are afflicted mental factors subsumed in the aggregate of formation, are secondary afflictions.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / dus che ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rgyud las 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na sgyu dang / rgyags pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / dus che ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / g-yo la sogs pa rnam pa du ma rgyud las 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: What are they? They are deceit, arrogance, violence, haughtiness, resentment, craftiness, and so on.

original: de la sgyu ni pha rol la slu ba'o //
analyzed: de la sgyu ni pha rol la slu ba'o //
translated: Deceit is the deceiving of others.üîΩ Arrogance is the overweening of the mind, the mind's lack of humility, due to attachment to one's own qualities of good family, good health, and so on.üîΩ Violence is the harming of others by beating, binding, killing, and so on.

original: rgyags pa ni gzugs dang lang tsho dang / rigs dang tshul khrims dang mang du thos pa la sogs pa rang gi chos rnams la chags te /
analyzed: rgyags pa ni gzugs dang lang tsho dang / rigs dang tshul khrims dang mang du thos pa la sogs pa rang gi chos rnams la chags te /
translated: Haughtiness is the lack of respect for others, due to attachment to one's own qualities of good family, good health, and so on.

original: gzhan la mi ltos par sems yongs su gtugs pa'o //üîΩrnam par 'tshe ba ni lag pa dang bong pa dang dbyig pas brdeg pa dang / tshig rtsub pos pha rol la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o ;üîΩ/ dus che ba ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po mang du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos par sems yongs su gtugs pa'o // rnam par 'tshe ba ni lag pa dang bong pa dang dbyig pas brdeg pa dang / tshig rtsub pos pha rol la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o ; / dus che ba ni kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa'i dngos po mang du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Resentment is the not letting go of an injury done by others.

original: de'i dbang gis rigs par bsgo ba mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rigs par bsgo ba mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Craftiness is the concealing of one's own faults.

original: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun du mnar sems kyi dngos po mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa ni kun du mnar sems kyi dngos po mang du byed pa'o //
translated: Resentment is the basis for the many kinds of malice.

original: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba ste /
analyzed: g-yo ni sems gya gyu ba ste /
translated: Guile is a crookedness of mind.

original: de'i dbang gis gzhan nas gzhan brgyud cing gung du 'dren te gsal bar mi rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis gzhan nas gzhan brgyud cing gung du 'dren te gsal bar mi rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: By its power, one leads others on by a roundabout path and does not make things clear.

original: de la de dag gi nang nas sgyu dang rgyags pa gnyis ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pas 'dod chags kyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de la de dag gi nang nas sgyu dang rgyags pa gnyis ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pas 'dod chags kyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Among these, deceit and arrogance are associated with desire because they are the natural outcome of desire.

original: 'dod chags kyi rigs la rten ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rigs la rten ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called the ‚Äúfamily‚Äù of desire, which means that they are based on desire.

original: khon du 'dzin pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba ni khong khro ba'i rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Resentment and violence are associated with anger.

original: dus che ba ni lta ba bsnyems pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //üîΩg-yo ni log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa ste gya gyu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dus che ba ni lta ba bsnyems pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o // g-yo ni log par lta ba'i rgyu mthun pa ste gya gyu ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: Conceit is the natural outcome of the inflated view.üîΩGuile is the natural outcome of false views.

original: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: What is crookedness? It is a sinful view.

original: kun nas dkris te 'dug pa ni bcu ste /
analyzed: kun nas dkris te 'dug pa ni bcu ste /
translated: There are ten entanglements:

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid @311b dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid @311b dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / khro ba dang 'chab pa'o //
translated: sleep, excitation, regret, envy, avarice, lack of conscience, shamelessness, anger, and concealment.

original: de la rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: de la rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung ba ste /
translated: Lethargy is the unserviceability of the body and mind.

original: slong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúsluggishness‚Äù because it is the opposite of serviceability.

original: gnyis ni lus dang sems 'dzin mi nus pa dang / sems sdud pa ste de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni lus dang sems 'dzin mi nus pa dang / sems sdud pa ste de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid yin pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the withdrawal of the mind and body that is associated with the mental factor of delusion. It is a state of mind that is completely withdrawn and associated with delusion.

original: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rgod pa ni sems ma zhi ba'o //
translated: Excitation is the non-tranquility of the mind.

original: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret is remorse about something bad that has been done.

original: 'dir ni de la dmigs pa sems las byung ba'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste yid la gcags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir ni de la dmigs pa sems las byung ba'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste yid la gcags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, regret is a mental factor that focuses on that and is called ‚Äúremorse‚Äù because it is a mental factor that is associated with regret.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu btags te dper na mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i chos la mi sdug ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu btags te dper na mi sdug pa la dmigs pa'i chos la mi sdug ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The cause is designated by the effect, as in the case of the expression ‚Äúthe meditation on the foul‚Äù which is a mental factor that focuses on the foul.

original: 'jig rten na yang gnas kyis gnas pa ston te /
analyzed: 'jig rten na yang gnas kyis gnas pa ston te /
translated: In the world, too, one is said to abide in a place by virtue of the place.üîΩ

original: dper na grong thams cad lhags so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na grong thams cad lhags so zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the world, one speaks of the village as the place where the villagers dwell.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa can nyid kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the defilements are said to dwell in the mind when they are in a state of envelopment.

original: phrag dog dang ser sna'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna'i mtshan nyid ni bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics of envy and avarice have already been explained.

original: ngo tsha med pa ni yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la mi gus pa ste /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa ni yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la mi gus pa ste /
translated: Lack of self-respect is disrespect for the good qualities and those who possess good qualities.

original: gus pa'i gnyen po'i chos so //
analyzed: gus pa'i gnyen po'i chos so //
translated: It is the factor that is the opposite of respect.

original: khrel med pa ni kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: khrel med pa ni kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par mi lta ba'o //
translated: Lack of modesty is the absence of fear of blame.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni gang dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ngan song du 'gro ba'o //üîΩkhro ba ni zhe sdang dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni gang dam pa rnams kyis smad pa ngan song du 'gro ba'o // khro ba ni zhe sdang dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs te /
translated: Blame is that which is condemned by the wise and which leads to bad rebirth.

original: sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: Anger is the state of a mind that is disturbed by the thought of doing harm to sentient beings and non-sentient things.

original: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho bas mkhyud pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni kha na ma tho bas mkhyud pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the hiding of one's faults by one who is attached to gain and honor.

original: sems las kun nas dkris te gnas pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems las kun nas dkris te gnas pas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa rnams so //
translated: The envelopment of the mind is the state of envelopment.

original: de dag la rmugs pa dang gnyid dang khrel med pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la rmugs pa dang gnyid dang khrel med pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Torpor, sleep, and shamelessness are the natural outflow of ignorance.

original: 'gyod pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni the tshom gyi rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Regret arises from doubt.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / rgod pa dang / ser sna ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / rgod pa dang / ser sna ni 'dod chags kyi rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Shamelessness, excitation, and avarice are the natural outflow of attachment.

original: khro ba dang phrag dog ni khong khro ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khro ba dang phrag dog ni khong khro ba las byung ba'o //
translated: Anger and envy arise from anger.

original: 'chab pa ni sred pa dang ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'chab pa ni sred pa dang ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: Concealment is the natural outflow of craving and ignorance.

original: dri ma rnam pa bcu po de dag rnams kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma rnam pa bcu po de dag rnams kyang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These ten defilements are called secondary defilements.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ba phra ste /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ba phra ste /
translated: The movement of mental factors is subtle.

original: de rgyun du 'bab pa yang bye brag phyed par mi nus na skad cig rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de rgyun du 'bab pa yang bye brag phyed par mi nus na skad cig rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is not possible to distinguish their continuous flow, what need is there to speak of their moments?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can @312a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can @312a * //
translated: Those who are wise and skilled in the characteristics of the Dharma taught by the Blessed One

original: dag gis ni de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong bas /
analyzed: dag gis ni de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong bas /
translated: see the distinction of its results.

original: de dag gi rigs gzhan skyon med pas rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de dag gi rigs gzhan skyon med pas rtogs kyi /
translated: But those who are free of the other types of faults understand it.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa'i slob dpon la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa 'khrul pa'i blo gros can dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa'i slob dpon la bsnyen bkur ma byas pa 'khrul pa'i blo gros can dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who are confused, who do not honor the masters who expound the scriptures of the Well-Gone One, do not understand it.

original: zag pa ni gsum ste 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o //üîΩde la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dod par gtogs pa'i /
analyzed: zag pa ni gsum ste 'dod pa'i zag pa dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa'o // de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dod par gtogs pa'i /
translated: There are three contaminations: the contamination of desire, the contamination of existence, and the contamination of ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris te 'dug pa dang bcas pa rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig po gang yin pa 'di ni 'dod pa'i zag pa ste ma rig pa lnga ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun nas dkris te 'dug pa dang bcas pa rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig po gang yin pa 'di ni 'dod pa'i zag pa ste ma rig pa lnga ma gtogs pa /
translated: The contamination of desire is the forty-one substances that are the afflictions of the desire realm, together with the entanglements, except for the ignorance of the desire realm.

original: phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig dang kun nas dkris te 'dug pa bcu'o //
analyzed: phra rgyas sum cu rtsa gcig dang kun nas dkris te 'dug pa bcu'o //
translated: This means the thirty-one branch afflictions, except for the five ignorances, and the ten entanglements.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa'i phra rgyas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa dang bcas pas rdzas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ni /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i ma rig pa ma gtogs pa'i phra rgyas kun nas dkris te 'dug pa dang bcas pas rdzas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ni /
translated: The contamination of existence is the fifty-four substances that are the branch afflictions and entanglements of the form and formless realms, except for the ignorance of the form and formless realms.

original: srid pa'i zag pa ste ;
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa ste ;
translated: The contaminants of existence are:

original: gzugs su gtogs pa'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa drug dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i dang / rmugs pa dang rgod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs su gtogs pa'i phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa drug dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i dang / rmugs pa dang rgod pa'o //
translated: the twenty-six anu≈õayas or latent tendencies that are associated with the realm of fine-materiality, the twenty-four anu≈õayas of the realm of immateriality, plus torpor and restlessness.

original: lung du mi ston par mtshungs pa dang nang du bltas par gyur pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyes pa gcig tu bsdus so //
analyzed: lung du mi ston par mtshungs pa dang nang du bltas par gyur pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyes pa gcig tu bsdus so //
translated: They are combined into one category because they are similar in being indeterminate, because they look inward, and because they are of the stage of the fundamental meditations.

analyzed: shes pa 'di gnyis rtogs pa ma yin pas lta ba'i bdag nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: lhag ma gzhan ni lta ba'i bdag nyid du 'grub po //

original: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni zag pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: The remaining knowledges are uncontaminated alone.

analyzed: pha rol gyi sems dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam shes pa bzhi po 'di dag ni 'dus byas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The four knowledges of the mind of another, suffering, origin, and path focus on the conditioned.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ni 'dus ma byas la dmigs pa'o //

original: lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gnyi ga la dmigs pa'o //

analyzed: de dag ni nang nas sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba shes pa'i spyod yul ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //

original: lhag ma rnams kyi spyod yul ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi spyod yul ni gnyi ga'o //

original: chos shes pa sa drug la ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa sa drug la ste /

analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi po rnams la'o//

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni sa dgu la ste /
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni sa dgu la ste /
translated: Subsequent knowledge focuses on nine levels.

original: sa drug po dag nyid dang / gzugs med pa gsum la'o //
analyzed: sa drug po dag nyid dang / gzugs med pa gsum la'o //
translated: It focuses on the six levels and the three formless realm states.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi bo rnams la'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi bo rnams la'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another focuses on the four absorptions.

original: lhag ma'i nang nas chos shes pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni sa drug la'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i nang nas chos shes pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni sa drug la'o //

original: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni sa dgu la'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni sa dgu la'o //
translated: The part of subsequent cognition is on nine levels.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni sa thams cad la'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni sa thams cad la'o //
translated: Conventional cognition is on all levels.

original: bzod pa ni brgyad de /

analyzed: de ni 'phags pa nyid kyi yin gyi /

original: byis pa yi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byis pa yi ni ma yin no //

analyzed: byis pa la ni de med pa dang chad kyis 'jigs pa'i de mi srid de //

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas ni ma yin no //

analyzed: bzhed pa tsam gyis yon tan phun sum tshogs pa de dag thams cad mngon du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams kho nar skyes te /

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not born elsewhere.

original: der skyes pa rnams la 'dod par gtogs pa'i lan grangs gzhan na myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der skyes pa rnams la 'dod par gtogs pa'i lan grangs gzhan na myong bar 'gyur ba'i las gdon mi za bar yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because those who are born there necessarily have actions to be experienced in a later life that are related to the realm of desire.

original: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la lhar skye ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod pa lta bu'o//
analyzed: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan pa rnams la lhar skye ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yod pa lta bu'o//
translated: For example, the Uttarakurus have actions to be experienced as a god.

original: khams gsum pa'i tshe sngon gyi las kyis 'phongs pa skye mched drug gi rgyun 'brel pa gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i tshe sngon gyi las kyis 'phongs pa skye mched drug gi rgyun 'brel pa gnas pa'i rgyur gyur pa /
translated: The faculty of life force is the cause of the duration of the stream of the six sense spheres, which is projected by previous karma in the three realms.

original: 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de ni srog gi dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the cause of designating a being is called the faculty of life force.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang srog gi dbang po gang zhe na khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang srog gi dbang po gang zhe na khams gsum pa'i tshe yin no //
translated: Also, the Abhidharma states, ‚ÄúWhat is the faculty of life force? It is life in the three realms.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang //
translated: ‚Äù And a verse states:

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes //
translated: Life, heat, and consciousness,

original: de dag nam zhig lus bor ba //
analyzed: de dag nam zhig lus bor ba //
translated: when they abandon the body,

original: de tshe spangs nas shi ba ni //
analyzed: de tshe spangs nas shi ba ni //
translated: then at that time, having been abandoned, death

original: dper na shing la sems med bzhin //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na shing la sems med bzhin // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is like a tree without mind.üîΩAlso, a sutra states:

original: mdo las kyang rnam par smin pa mngon par grub na sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: mdo las kyang rnam par smin pa mngon par grub na sems can dmyal ba zhes bya ba'i grangs su 'gro ba de bzhin du /
translated: When the fully ripened effect is established, it is counted as a hell being, and similarly,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du 'gro ba'i bar gyi grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du 'gro ba'i bar gyi grangs su 'gro'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: it is counted as a being of the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: srog gi dbang po ma gtogs par gang skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu khams gsum la khyab pa'i dbang po gzhan med do //üîΩ'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu'i chos med @319a * //üîΩdu zin na gzugs med par skyes pa rnams /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ma gtogs par gang skye ba'i rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur ba 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu khams gsum la khyab pa'i dbang po gzhan med do // 'gro bar gdags pa'i rgyu'i chos med @319a * // du zin na gzugs med par skyes pa rnams /
translated: There is no other faculty that pervades the three realms and is the cause of the designation of a living being, except for the faculty of life force.

original: dge ba dang bsgribs pa dang / sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du byed pa na 'chi 'pho dang skye bar thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang bsgribs pa dang / sa 'og ma pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems mngon du byed pa na 'chi 'pho dang skye bar thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no such faculty, then when beings born in the formless realm manifest a virtuous mind, an obscured mind, or a uncontaminated mind of a lower level, they would die and be reborn.

original: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni sems can rnams kyi don gcig la 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa nyid ni sems can rnams kyi don gcig la 'dod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Homogeneity is the cause of the desire for the same object by sentient beings.

original: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / tha dad pa'o //
translated: It is also nondifferent and different.üîΩNondifferent homogeneityüîΩis the concordance of sentient beings in desiring the same object, such as desiring to eat food.

original: de la tha dad pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Different homogeneity

original: sems can thams cad bdag la chags pa dang / kha zas 'dod par sems can so sor mthun pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag la chags pa dang / kha zas 'dod par sems can so sor mthun pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: is the concordance of sentient beings in desiring the same object, such as desiring to eat food.

original: tha dad pa ni khams dang sa dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang / rigs dang bud med dang skyes pa dang / dge slong dang dge bsnyen dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de rnams kyi don gcig la 'dod pa'i nges pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni khams dang sa dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang / rigs dang bud med dang skyes pa dang / dge slong dang dge bsnyen dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa de rnams kyi don gcig la 'dod pa'i nges pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The specific is the difference of realm, stage, destiny, birth, type, female, male, monk, layperson, trainee, non-trainee, etc. The cause of the determination of the desire for the same object of those who are different is the homogeneity.

original: de med du zin na 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad 'dres pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na 'phags pa dang 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad thams cad 'dres pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that did not exist, there would be the fault of the confusion of all worldly conventions of the noble and the non-noble, etc.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang // so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid la tha dad du dbye ba ci yod /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang // so so'i skye bo'i skal ba mnyam pa nyid la tha dad du dbye ba ci yod /
translated: What is the difference in the classification of the state of being an ordinary being and the homogeneity of an ordinary being?

original: 'dod pa mthun pa'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bshad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa mthun pa'i rgyu ni skal ba mnyam pa nyid ces bshad do //
translated: The cause of the agreement of desire is explained as homogeneity.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid ni gnod pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid ni gnod pa thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: The state of being an ordinary being is the source of all harm.

original: 'di lta ste 'gro ba'i gtso bos kyang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'gro ba'i gtso bos kyang /
translated: As the chief of the world said:

original: dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las mi byed pa ci yang med do zhes nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag byis pa so so'i skye bo thos pa dang mi ldan pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i las mi byed pa ci yang med do zhes nga smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Monks, I say that there is nothing that a fool, an ordinary person, who is not learned, will not do out of desire and delusion.

original: gzhan nas kyang gal te 'dir 'ong na ni /
analyzed: gzhan nas kyang gal te 'dir 'ong na ni /
translated: And elsewhere: If he comes here,

original: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob po zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa nyid rab tu 'thob po zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: he will obtain the state of a human being.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid la ni de ltar thob pa dang 'dor ba med de /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid la ni de ltar thob pa dang 'dor ba med de /
translated: But an ordinary person does not obtain or lose that state.

original: de bas na de bye brag shin tu che'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bye brag shin tu che'o //
translated: Therefore, there is a great difference between them.

original: skye ba ni chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag ste /
analyzed: skye ba ni chos skye ba'i nang gi yan lag ste /
translated: Arising is the internal cause of the arising of a dharma,

original: rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rang gi nus pa 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: because it is the cause of the acquisition of its power.

original: chos skye ba'i rgyu gnyis te /
analyzed: chos skye ba'i rgyu gnyis te /
translated: There are two causes of the arising of a dharma:

original: nang gi yan lag dang / phyi'i yan lag go //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag dang / phyi'i yan lag go //
translated: an internal cause and an external cause.

original: de la nang gi yan lag ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la nang gi yan lag ni skye ba'o //
translated: The internal cause is arising.

original: phyi'i yan lag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams so //
analyzed: phyi'i yan lag ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams so //
translated: The external cause is the conditions.üîΩIf that does not exist, the external cause is not activated,

original: de med du zin na phyi'i yan lag rnams bskyod kyang /
analyzed: de med du zin na phyi'i yan lag rnams bskyod kyang /
translated: even though it is present.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du chos skye bar mi 'gyur ba ngang /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du chos skye bar mi 'gyur ba ngang /
translated: If it were not so, then the arising of a factor would not be possible, as in the case of space.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang 'dus byas su 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa yang 'dus byas su 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And space, etc. would be conditioned factors.

original: gnas pa ni 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus kyi gnas kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'bras bu gzhan 'phen pa'i dus kyi gnas kyi rgyu ste /
translated: Duration is the cause of the persistence of a factor in the state of projecting its effect.

original: chos gnas na 'bras bu gzhan 'phen nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gnas na 'bras bu gzhan 'phen nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a factor endures, it is capable of projecting its effect.

original: @319b de bas na gang gi dbang gis 'bras bu 'phen pa'i chos de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @319b de bas na gang gi dbang gis 'bras bu 'phen pa'i chos de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the factor which, by its power, projects its effect, is called duration.

original: de med du zin na 'phen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na 'phen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did not exist, the effect would not be projected.

original: dga' ba ni 'bras bu gnyis pa 'phen nus pa la gnod pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni 'bras bu gnyis pa 'phen nus pa la gnod pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Impermanence is the cause of the destruction of the factor which is capable of projecting its effect.

original: gal te chos gang 'bras bu 'phen nus pa de la gnod pa'i rgyu med du zin na chos de 'bras bu du ma 'phen nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chos gang 'bras bu 'phen nus pa de la gnod pa'i rgyu med du zin na chos de 'bras bu du ma 'phen nus par 'gyur te /
translated: If the factor which is capable of projecting its effect were not to encounter a cause of destruction, it would be capable of projecting its effect indefinitely.

original: de lta na ni skad cig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni skad cig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this hypothesis, it would not be momentary.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni gnod par byed nus pa 'das par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni gnod par byed nus pa 'das par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: Impermanence is the cause of the destruction of the factor which is capable of projecting its effect.

original: chos gang gis da ltar las spos nas 'das par byed pa'i chos de ni mi rtag pa de nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang gis da ltar las spos nas 'das par byed pa'i chos de ni mi rtag pa de nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The factor which causes the transformation of the present action into the past is called impermanence.

original: de med du zin na chos 'jig pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med du zin na chos 'jig pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa yang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this factor did not exist, the destruction of factors would not exist; and space, etc., would be destroyed.

original: bzhi po de dag ni 'dus byas dag gi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ni 'dus byas dag gi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: These four are the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: chos gang la 'di bzhi yod pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pas 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang la 'di bzhi yod pa de ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pas 'dus byas zhes bya'o //
translated: The factor in which these four are found is called conditioned because it is endowed with the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: ji skad du 'jig rten gyi mgon pos kyang /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jig rten gyi mgon pos kyang /
translated: As the Lord of the World has said:

original: dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas dag gi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni 'dus byas dag gi 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, these three are the characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: 'dus byas la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang snang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas la skye ba dang / 'jig pa dang / gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang snang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: In conditioned factors, origination is seen, destruction is seen, and change while enduring is seen.‚Äù

original: gnas pa ni 'dir 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni 'dir 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir te /
translated: Here, endurance is mentioned because of the influence of the Vinaya.

original: skye ba skyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal can ma dang sna nag ma 'grogs pa bzhin du gnas pa dang / dga' ba 'grogs par gcig tu bsdus te gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skye ba skyed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal can ma dang sna nag ma 'grogs pa bzhin du gnas pa dang / dga' ba 'grogs par gcig tu bsdus te gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has said that the arising of arising is the cause of the arising of the basic arising, just as ≈örƒ´mƒÅt·πõkƒÅ and KƒÅ·πá·∏çarƒ´yƒÅ are the wives of one man.

original: de dag ni chos kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni chos kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: The four characteristics are not the self of phenomena.

original: gal te bdag nyid du gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid du gyur na ni /
translated: If they were the self of phenomena,

original: des na ji ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid rnams tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang / mtshan nyid rnams tha dad pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: then just as the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics are not different,

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so the characteristics would not be different from each other.

original: de ltar gyur na yang skye ba gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang skye ba gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then that which arises would also cease,

original: 'jig pa gang yin pa de nyid skye bar 'gyur ba dang / chos mi skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa gang yin pa de nyid skye bar 'gyur ba dang / chos mi skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: that which ceases would also arise, and phenomena would not arise at all.

original: mtshan nyid rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bzhi ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyang bzhi ste /
translated: The four secondary characteristics of the characteristics are

original: skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The arising of arising, etc.

original: 'di las thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di las thug pa med par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: But there is no infinite regress here.

original: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid dag ni chos brgyad po dag la 'jug go //üîΩrjes su @320a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i mtshan nyid dag ni chos brgyad po dag la 'jug go // rjes su @320a * //
translated: The primary characteristics are applied to the eight dharmas.

original: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni re re la'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i mtshan nyid rnams ni re re la'o //
translated: The secondary characteristics are applied to each.

original: de la skye ba ni bdag la gtogs pa chos brgyad po dag gi nang gi yan lag rang gi nus pa'i 'thob pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de la skye ba ni bdag la gtogs pa chos brgyad po dag gi nang gi yan lag rang gi nus pa'i 'thob pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Among the eight dharmas belonging to the self, arising is the cause of obtaining the power of each part.

original: rtsa ba'i chos dang mtshan nyid gsum po rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan dan mtshan nyid gsum po rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po rnams la'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i chos dang mtshan nyid gsum po rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan dan mtshan nyid gsum po rnams dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid bzhi po rnams la'o //
translated: It is the cause of obtaining the power of the primary dharma, the three characteristics, the four secondary characteristics, and the three characteristics of the secondary characteristics.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du de bzhin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi bar du de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true up to impermanence.

original: bdag ma gtogs pa chos brgyad po rnams kyi rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: bdag ma gtogs pa chos brgyad po rnams kyi rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Impermanence is the cause of the destruction of the eight dharmas, excluding the self.

original: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba nyid kyi yin pa nas /
analyzed: skye ba'i skye ba ni skye ba nyid kyi yin pa nas /
translated: The arising of arising is the cause of the arising of arising.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyi yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid kyi yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The impermanence of the impermanence of the conditioned is the impermanence of the conditioned.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni rtsa ba'i chos la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni rtsa ba'i chos la gnas pa'o //
translated: The characteristics are based on the primary thing.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni mtshan nyid rnams la gnas so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni mtshan nyid rnams la gnas so //
translated: The secondary characteristics are based on the characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The characteristics have been explained.

original: da ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the collection of names, etc., should be mentioned.

original: de la gang dag ngag rnams la rag las te skye ba /
analyzed: de la gang dag ngag rnams la rag las te skye ba /
translated: The collection of names is that which arises in dependence on speech,

original: shes pa bzhin du don gyi tshul gyis gnas lta bu'i rnam par rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa /
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du don gyi tshul gyis gnas lta bu'i rnam par rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa /
translated: like consciousness, which is the receptacle of the mode of being of the object, and which causes one to understand its own object by means of a form that is like the object.

original: 'du shes dang / ngag dang / yi ge'i 'bru zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba de dag ni /
analyzed: 'du shes dang / ngag dang / yi ge'i 'bru zhes rnam grangs gzhan gyis brjod par bya ba de dag ni /
translated: It is also called the collection of ideas, the collection of words, and the collection of syllables.

original: go rims bzhin du ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge rnams shes par bya'o //üîΩdper na mig la sogs pa la rag las te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge rnams shes par bya'o // dper na mig la sogs pa la rag las te /
translated: One should know that these are, respectively, name, word, and syllable.

original: skye ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: skye ba mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa /
translated: For example, visual consciousness, etc., arise in dependence on the eye, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi tshul gyis gnas lta bu'i rnam par rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don gyi tshul gyis gnas lta bu'i rnam par rang gi don khong du chud par byed pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: like the forms of the words, etc., which are the means of understanding the meaning.

original: ngag gi sgras ni don brjod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngag gi sgras ni don brjod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning is not expressed by the sound of the word,

original: me zhes brjod pas tshig par gyur ta re /
analyzed: me zhes brjod pas tshig par gyur ta re /
translated: because the word is burned up by the fire.

original: ngag tu brjod pas ni me'i ming brjod pa yin no //üîΩmig gis ni me'i don khong du chud par byed de /
analyzed: ngag tu brjod pas ni me'i ming brjod pa yin no // mig gis ni me'i don khong du chud par byed de /
translated: The word is expressed by the voice,üîΩand the meaning of the word is understood by the eye.

original: de'i blo skyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩsgra ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / de las gzhan du brda sprod pa pas brtag go zhes yongs su brtags pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i blo skyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // sgra ni thogs pa dang bcas pa dang / de las gzhan du brda sprod pa pas brtag go zhes yongs su brtags pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The eye produces the idea of the meaning, that is the idea.üîΩThe sound is obstructed and the meaning is understood from it, but the sound is not obstructed.

original: de las don khong du chud pa brtag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de las don khong du chud pa brtag pa mi rigs so //
translated: The sound is not the means of understanding the meaning, because the sound is not established as being obstructed or unobstructed.

original: sgra dang ming dang don dang / shes pa chos bzhi po 'di dag ni ngo bo gcig pa 'dra bar snang ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang ming dang don dang / shes pa chos bzhi po 'di dag ni ngo bo gcig pa 'dra bar snang ngo //
translated: The sound and the name and the meaning and the idea, these four things are of the same nature, appearing as similar.

original: de la gzugs sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the name is the sound, such as ‚Äúform,‚Äù etc.üîΩThe meaning is the object, such as the form, etc.

original: tshig ni yi ge'i 'bru ji snyed kyis /
analyzed: tshig ni yi ge'i 'bru ji snyed kyis /
translated: The words are the syllables, however many there are,

original: 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: by which the desired meaning is completely fulfilled.

original: @320b dper na /
analyzed: @320b dper na /
translated: For example,

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not do any evil,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa dang / 'jig rten na yang lha sbyin ba dkar mo khrid de shog ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa dang / 'jig rten na yang lha sbyin ba dkar mo khrid de shog ces bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and so on, in verse, and in the world, ‚ÄúBring Devadatta and white cow,‚Äù and so on.

original: yi ge ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yi ge ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The letters are as follows:

original: aa zhes bya ba yi ge 'bru gcig go //
analyzed: aa zhes bya ba yi ge 'bru gcig go //
translated: ‚ÄúA‚Äù is one syllable.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge so so na mang ba ni /
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge so so na mang ba ni /
translated: The many individual names, words, and letters

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams shes pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams shes pa'o //
translated: are the collections of names, words, and letters.

original: drang srong chen pos kyang dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung nas /
analyzed: drang srong chen pos kyang dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung nas /
translated: The great sage also said, ‚ÄúMonks, when the TathƒÅgata appears in the world,

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams shes so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams shes so zhes gsungs te /
translated: he knows the collections of names, words, and letters.‚Äù

original: phung po dang skye mched dang / khams dang / bden pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: phung po dang skye mched dang / khams dang / bden pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that the aggregates, sense bases, elements, truths, fruits of asceticism, dependent origination, and so on are all included in the aggregates.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pas /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pas /
translated: Moreover, the TathƒÅgata has said:

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs de dang / de dag brnyes so zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs de dang / de dag brnyes so zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúI have attained those collections of names, phrases, and letters.‚Äù

original: de bas na ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yod pa nyid do ;
analyzed: de bas na ming gi tshogs la sogs pa yod pa nyid do ;
translated: Therefore, the collections of names and so on do exist.

original: /'du byed kyi dngos po ni 'di snyed do //
analyzed: /'du byed kyi dngos po ni 'di snyed do //
translated: There are just this many kinds of conditioned things.

original: da ni rnam par shes pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rnam par shes pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, consciousness must be explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dngos po tsam so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi dngos po tsam so sor rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Consciousness is the individual cognition of the mere thing that is the object, such as form.

original: mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyus yongs su zin na 'byung nus pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyus yongs su zin na 'byung nus pa /
translated: It occurs when it is supported by the eye and so on, which are its cooperative causes.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po rnams la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul drug po rnams la /
translated: It is the cognition of the mere thing that is the six objects, such as form.

original: dngos po tsam khong du chud pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam khong du chud pa'i chos gang yin pa de ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: That dharma which is the cognition of the mere thing is consciousness.

original: de bye brag khong du chud pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bye brag khong du chud pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the understanding of the particulars,

original: bye brag khong du chud par byed pa ni ra ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bye brag khong du chud par byed pa ni ra ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa ste /

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi skad cig tsam la dmigs pa /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi skad cig tsam la dmigs pa /

original: yid dang sems kyi rnam grangs su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yid dang sems kyi rnam grangs su brjod pa'o //

analyzed: dang po'i sems can gyi rdzas gdags pa'i rgyu dang gzugs la sogs pa /

original: yul so sor rnam par rig pa yang byed pa'o //
analyzed: yul so sor rnam par rig pa yang byed pa'o //

original: de yang yul gyi bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang yul gyi bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu 'gyur te /

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dag go //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar dag go //
translated: It is from the visual consciousness to the mental consciousness.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi ste /
translated: Its definition is that of the Lord himself:

original: sna tshogs shes pas rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs shes pas rnam par shes pa'o //

original: rnam par shes pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i dngos po'o //

analyzed: de dag kyang de'i 'o //
