analyzed: de la lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu ni phan tshun gyi stobs kyis /
translated: The co-existent cause is like the mutual strength of companions

original: lam gyi dgon pa las byung ba'i tshul du'o //
analyzed: lam gyi dgon pa las byung ba'i tshul du'o //
translated: in the manner of emerging from a difficult path.üîΩThe associated cause is like the mutual support of companions

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni gcig la gcig lam brgyags kyis mthud pa'i tshul du'o //üîΩsems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni gcig la gcig lam brgyags kyis mthud pa'i tshul du'o // sems kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams ni /
translated: in the manner of a caravan.üîΩThe mind and mental factors are the homogeneous cause of all the mental factors.

original: sems las byung ba thams cad dang / bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gang dag sems de'i yin pa dag go //
analyzed: sems las byung ba thams cad dang / bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag dang / 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gang dag sems de'i yin pa dag go //
translated: The absorptions and uncontaminated vows, and the characteristics of conditioned phenomena that belong to that mind, are the homogeneous cause of that mind.

original: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig tu /
analyzed: de dag ni sems dang lhan cig tu /
translated: They are the homogeneous cause of the mind that arises simultaneously with them.

original: dus dang skye ba dang gnas dang 'gag pa gcig dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa dang rnam par smin pa gcig dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa'i sems su gyur na dge ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dus dang skye ba dang gnas dang 'gag pa gcig dang / 'bras bu dang rgyu mthun pa dang rnam par smin pa gcig dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du mi ston pa'i sems su gyur na dge ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: 1. cause of similar outcome, 2. cause of universal occurrence, 3. cause of karmic maturation, 4. cause of separation, 5. cause of the support, 6. cause of the natural outcome, 7. cause of the spiritual level, 8. cause of the mental faculty, 9. cause of the absence of error, and 10. cause of the absence of deficiency.

original: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag gi sems kyi rjes su gzung ba rnams zhes bya'o //üîΩrang gi sa dang rang gi ris pa'i chos 'dra ba sngar skyes pa rnams ni /üîΩchos 'dra ba phyis skye ba rnams kyi /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu bcu po de dag gi sems kyi rjes su gzung ba rnams zhes bya'o // rang gi sa dang rang gi ris pa'i chos 'dra ba sngar skyes pa rnams ni / chos 'dra ba phyis skye ba rnams kyi /
translated: The ten causes are so called because they are the causes of the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe homogeneous cause is the similar and immediately antecedent condition.üîΩThe similar and immediately antecedent condition is the cause of the similar and immediately subsequent factors.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //üîΩrang gi sa pa kun du 'gro ba sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos phyis skyes pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyis skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no // rang gi sa pa kun du 'gro ba sngar skyes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos phyis skyes pa rnams kyi kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the cause of similar and immediately subsequent factors.üîΩThe universal cause is the cause of the defiled factors.üîΩThe universal cause is the cause of defiled factors.üîΩThe cause of karmic maturation is the cause of the karmic maturation.

original: mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The cause of karmic maturation is the cause of the karmic maturation.

original: de dag rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rnam par smin par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the factors that are the ripened effect.

original: chos skye ba ni rang bzhin ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed cing mi sgrib pa'i dngos pos byed @321b pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: chos skye ba ni rang bzhin ma gtogs pa chos thams cad ni skye ba la bgegs mi byed cing mi sgrib pa'i dngos pos byed @321b pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the arising of a factor is all factors except itself, for they do not make an obstacle to the arising of the factor.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad dang 'dus ma byas la gcig go //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni 'dus byas kyi chos thams cad dang 'dus ma byas la gcig go //
translated: The effect of dominance is all conditioned factors and also the unconditioned factors.

original: de dag kyang lnga ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang lnga ste /
translated: The effect of dominance is of five types:

original: skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: effect of human action, effect of dominance, effect of equal outflow, effect of retribution, effect of disconnection.

original: de lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: de lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The coexistent cause and the associated cause are the effect of human action.

original: gang gi stobs kyis na gang 'byung ba de'i ste /
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis na gang 'byung ba de'i ste /
translated: The effect of dominance is the factor by the force of which other factors arise.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The effect of dominance is called the effect of human action.

original: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The homogeneous cause and the pervasive cause are the effect of similar outcome.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos ni rgyu mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i chos ni rgyu mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A phenomenon similar to its cause is called a similar outcome.

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyu ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The ripening cause is the effect of karmic maturation.

original: rgyu dang mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang mi 'dra bar smin pa ni rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: Maturation is dissimilar to its cause.

original: sems zhes bya ba ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba ma bsgribs la lung du mi ston pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The mind is the nature of unobscured indeterminate.

original: byed pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: The active cause is the effect of conscious effort.

original: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yin pa dang / zhing pa la sogs pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lta bur de'i dbang gis de skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na mig gi rnam par shes pa ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yin pa dang / zhing pa la sogs pa'i lo tog la sogs pa lta bur de'i dbang gis de skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, the eye consciousness is the effect of name-and-form and so on and the effect of farmers and so on is the harvest and so forth because it is generated by the power of those.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni bral ba'i 'bras bu zhes bya ste /
translated: Nirvana is called the effect of separation.

original: de ni thob par bya ba yin gyi bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni thob par bya ba yin gyi bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is to be obtained but it is not to be generated.

original: rkyen ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rkyen ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four conditions:

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen no //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen no //
translated: 1. causal condition, 2. immediately antecedent condition, 3. object condition, 4. dominant condition.

original: de la byed pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga po dag ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de la byed pa'i rgyu ma gtogs pa rgyu lnga po dag ni rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: The five causes, excluding the active cause, are the causal condition.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi tha ma ma gtogs pa ni 'bras bu'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi tha ma ma gtogs pa ni 'bras bu'i de ma thag pa'i rkyen no //
translated: The immediately antecedent condition is the immediately antecedent mind and mental activities, excluding the last mind and mental activities of the Arhat.

original: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rkyen ni chos thams cad do //
translated: The object condition is all dharmas.

original: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen ni byed pa'i rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The dominant condition is the active cause.

original: nam mkha' ni bsags pa'i rdzas skye ba de'i skabs 'byed pa de'i bdag nyid ni nam mkha'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni bsags pa'i rdzas skye ba de'i skabs 'byed pa de'i bdag nyid ni nam mkha'o //
translated: Space is the absence of obstruction to the arising of material things.

analyzed: de med du zin na bsags pa'i rdzas mi skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //

original: rlung ci la brten /

original: rlung nam mkha' la'o //
analyzed: rlung nam mkha' la'o //

original: kye goo ta ma nam mkha' ci la brten /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma nam mkha' ci la brten /

original: bram ze ha cang thal ches te /
analyzed: bram ze ha cang thal ches te /

original: dri ba rnams kyi mtha' rtogs par mi nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ba rnams kyi mtha' rtogs par mi nus par 'gyur ro //

original: 'on kyang snang ba yod pas nam mkha' mngon no /
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba yod pas nam mkha' mngon no /

original: @322a * // nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa /
analyzed: @322a * // nam mkha' ni gzugs med pa /
translated: Space is formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be shown,

original: thogs pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa yin na /
translated: and is not obstructive.üîΩWhat could it be based on? Nevertheless, since light exists, space is known.

original: de ci la brten par 'gyur 'on kyang snang ba yod pas nam mkhar shes so zhes bde bar gshegs pas kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de ci la brten par 'gyur 'on kyang snang ba yod pas nam mkhar shes so zhes bde bar gshegs pas kyang gsungs so //
translated: The Well-Gone One has also said this.

original: nam mkha'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dngos po'o //
translated: The thing called space is the mere absence of form.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal spong ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa ni sdug bsngal spong ba'o //

original: sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering?

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: skye ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: birth is suffering.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩMonks, suffering is the manifestation of existence.

analyzed: dge slong dag sdug bsngal ni srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'o zhes rgya cher gsungs so //

original: srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i 'jug pa de'i 'jug pa med pa ni spong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa mngon par 'grub pa'i 'jug pa de'i 'jug pa med pa ni spong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The non-occurrence of that occurrence of the establishment of existence is called ‚Äúabandonment.‚Äù

original: rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa brag lta bur gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rlung rgyu ba thogs par byed pa brag lta bur gnas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is like a rock, which obstructs the movement of the wind,

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa zhes bya'o //

original: 'dis bden pa bzhi po dag la so sor brtags pas /
analyzed: 'dis bden pa bzhi po dag la so sor brtags pas /

original: so sor brtags pa ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ste /

original: blo'i bye brag dge ba'o //
analyzed: blo'i bye brag dge ba'o //

original: des 'gog pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: des 'gog pa thob pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: That cessation which is attained through it is cessation through deliberation.

original: de ni spang bar bya ba mtha' yas pa bzhin du mtha' yas te gcig pa ma yin no //üîΩgal te gcig pa zhig yin na ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig snga ma nyid kyis des mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni spang bar bya ba mtha' yas pa bzhin du mtha' yas te gcig pa ma yin no // gal te gcig pa zhig yin na ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi skad cig snga ma nyid kyis des mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not singular, since it is limitless like the limitless objects to be abandoned.

original: lam bsgom pa phyi ma don dam par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa phyi ma don dam par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were singular, then the later cultivation of the path would be pointless, because the former moment of the ƒÅrya path would have already actualized it.

original: cung zad mngon sum du byed par rtogs na ni yan lag dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cung zad mngon sum du byed par rtogs na ni yan lag dang bcas par 'gyur ro //

original: de bas na zag pa'i rdzas ji ltar snyed par /
analyzed: de bas na zag pa'i rdzas ji ltar snyed par /
translated: Therefore, as many times as there are substantial defiling objects,üîΩ

analyzed: spong ba'i rdzas kyang de snyed kho nar rtogs pa 'di ni legs so //
translated: Therefore, it is good to understand that the substance of abandonment is just as much as the substance of the contaminants.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir gzhag ste //
translated: This is established as fourfold by the distinction of fruits:

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom ba'i 'bras bu'o //

original: spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i khams kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i khams kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold by the distinction of the realms of abandonment, separation from attachment, and cessation.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gnyis po'i spong ba'i bye brag gam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa gnyis po'i spong ba'i bye brag gam /

original: phung po dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i dbyings kyi bye brag gis yang rnam pa gnyis @322b so ;
analyzed: phung po dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i dbyings kyi bye brag gis yang rnam pa gnyis @322b so ;
translated: or by the distinction of the realm with remainder and the realm without remainder of the aggregates.

original: / mtshams sbyor ba med pa skye ba 'gog par rnam par gzhag pas na gcig go //
analyzed: / mtshams sbyor ba med pa skye ba 'gog par rnam par gzhag pas na gcig go //
translated: It is one because it is established as the cessation of birth without further connection.

original: de'i rnam grangs ni zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam grangs ni zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its synonyms are: extinction, separation from desire, cessation, nirvana, and so on.

original: de skad du mi'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de skad du mi'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Human Sutra says:

original: dge slong dag phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po 'di dag dang / mig gi dbang po gzugs can dang / de dag ni mi nyid de 'di la sems can dang / mi dang / shed las skyes te /
analyzed: dge slong dag phung po gzugs can ma yin pa bzhi po 'di dag dang / mig gi dbang po gzugs can dang / de dag ni mi nyid de 'di la sems can dang / mi dang / shed las skyes te /
translated: Monks, these four non-material aggregates and the material eye faculty are human. Here, sentient being, human, and human being are the essence.

original: shed bu zhes bya ba 'di ni ming ngo //
analyzed: shed bu zhes bya ba 'di ni ming ngo //
translated: Human, human being, and person are the name.

original: 'di la bdag gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo snyam pa 'di ni dam 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bdag gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo snyam pa 'di ni dam 'cha' ba'o //
translated: Here, I see forms is the vow.

original: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa de'i ming ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba 'di ni tha snyad do zhes rgya cher brjod cing /
analyzed: 'di la tshe dang ldan pa de'i ming ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya ba 'di ni tha snyad do zhes rgya cher brjod cing /
translated: Here, the name of that venerable one is so-and-so is the convention.

original: dge slong dag de ltar na /üîΩ'di ni ming tsam mo //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na / 'di ni ming tsam mo //
translated: Monks, thusüîΩthis is mere name.

original: 'di ni tha snyad tsam mo //
analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad tsam mo //
translated: This is mere convention.

original: dge slong dag chos 'di dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang / sems pas 'phags pa dang / 'dus byas dang / sems pa las byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag chos 'di dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang / sems pas 'phags pa dang / 'dus byas dang / sems pa las byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dag ste /
translated: arisen from intention, conditioned, arisen from mind, and dependently originated.

original: mi rtag pa nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar du gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bar du gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Whatever is impermanent up to dependently originated is suffering.

original: sdug bsngal de skye ba yang sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de skye ba yang sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The arising of suffering is suffering.

original: gnas pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'byung ba yang sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / mngon par 'grub pa dang / 'byung ba yang sdug bsngal te /
translated: Abiding, manifestation, and occurrence are also suffering.

original: sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs pa dang / nges par spangs pa dang / byang par gyur pa dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / nub pa dang / sdug bsngal gzhan gyi mtshams mi sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'di ma lus par spangs pa dang / nges par spangs pa dang / byang par gyur pa dang / zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / rnam par zhi ba dang / nub pa dang / sdug bsngal gzhan gyi mtshams mi sbyor ba dang /
translated: The complete abandonment of this suffering, the definite abandonment, the removal, the exhaustion, the detachment, the cessation, the pacification, the disappearance, the non-connection,

original: len pa med pa dang / mi 'byung pa gang yin pa de zhi ba /
analyzed: len pa med pa dang / mi 'byung pa gang yin pa de zhi ba /
translated: the non-appropriation, and the non-occurrence of this suffering is peace.

original: de gya nom pa ste /
analyzed: de gya nom pa ste /
translated: That is excellent.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: phung po thams cad nges par spangs pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po thams cad nges par spangs pa dang / sred pa zad pa dang ; 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the definite relinquishment of all the aggregates, the exhaustion of craving, the absence of attachment, cessation, and nirvana.

original: de la 'dis phung po thams cad rab tu 'dor bas phung po thams cad dang bral ba'o //üîΩ'di mthong ngam /
analyzed: de la 'dis phung po thams cad rab tu 'dor bas phung po thams cad dang bral ba'o // 'di mthong ngam /
translated: Here, it is the absence of all the aggregates because it is the complete relinquishment of all the aggregates.

original: thos na sred pa zad par 'gyur bas sred pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: thos na sred pa zad par 'gyur bas sred pa zad pa'o //
translated: It is the exhaustion of craving because craving is exhausted when it is seen or heard.

original: @323a * // 'di thob nas 'dod chags med par 'gyur bas 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: @323a * // 'di thob nas 'dod chags med par 'gyur bas 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is the absence of attachment because one becomes free from attachment when one attains it.

original: 'di mngon sum du byas na sdug bsngal 'gag pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di mngon sum du byas na sdug bsngal 'gag pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: It is cessation because suffering ceases when it is actualized.

original: 'di thob na gnod pa thams cad dang / 'tshe ba thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'das pas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thob na gnod pa thams cad dang / 'tshe ba thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad las 'das pas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: It is nirvana because one transcends all harm, all injury, and all afflictions when one attains it.

original: so sor brtags pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: It is the object of thorough analysis.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa las gzhan pa /
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa las gzhan pa /
translated: It is different from the cessation that is due to thorough analysis.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos skye ba la gtan du bgegs su gyur pa'i chos so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med par rkyen ma tshang ba nyid kyis thob pa gang yin ba de ni ;
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos skye ba la gtan du bgegs su gyur pa'i chos so sor brtags pas 'gog pa med par rkyen ma tshang ba nyid kyis thob pa gang yin ba de ni ;
translated: That which is obtained by the mere incompleteness of conditions without the analytical cessation of a phenomenon that is an obstruction to the future arising of a phenomenon is called nonanalytical cessation.üîΩüîΩ

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The nonanalytical cessation is the nonarising of future phenomena due to the absence of conditions, not due to the analytical cessation that is the permanent obstruction to the arising of future phenomena.

original: dper na mig gis yid gzugs shig la yengs nas /
analyzed: dper na mig gis yid gzugs shig la yengs nas /

analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gzugs gzhan dag dang / sgra dang dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams dang / chos rnams las kha cig 'gag pa ni /

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba gang dag skye bar 'gyur ba de dag gis thos na mi skye ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems dang / sems las byung ba gang dag skye bar 'gyur ba de dag gis thos na mi skye ste /

original: des de dag 'gag par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: des de dag 'gag par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang gi tshe bde ba tshor ba mngon du gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gang gi tshe bde ba tshor ba mngon du gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said: When a pleasant feeling is manifest,

original: 'di sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gnyis 'gog go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gnyis 'gog go zhes gsungs so //
translated: and also of the sensation that is neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.üîΩThe Fortunate One also says:

original: yang dge slong 'di'i sems can dmyal ba rnams zad do //
analyzed: yang dge slong 'di'i sems can dmyal ba rnams zad do //
translated: ‚ÄúFor this monk, the hells are destroyed,

original: dud 'gro rnams zad do //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams zad do //
translated: animal wombs are destroyed,

original: yi dags rnams zad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yi dags rnams zad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: the worlds of the ancestors are destroyed.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: This is the unconditioned factor called cessation not due to deliberation.

original: 'di ni las dang po pa dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni las dang po pa dga' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to delight beginners,

original: dpyad pa mang po med par bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: dpyad pa mang po med par bkod pa yin te /
translated: we have not multiplied the examinations.

original: gang dag chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par mi shes bzhin du /
analyzed: gang dag chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid la mkhas par mi shes bzhin du /
translated: Those who, without knowing the characteristics of the Abhidharma,

analyzed: rang gi blo gros kyis mtshan du brjod pa mang po rnam par bsgrubs nas /
translated: have established, by their own thought, many definitions of the characteristics,

original: mdun du gzhag ste /
analyzed: mdun du gzhag ste /
translated: and who, placing them in the forefront,

original: klan ka ngan pa'i mda' rnams kyis 'bigs par 'dod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: klan ka ngan pa'i mda' rnams kyis 'bigs par 'dod pa de dag ni /
translated: wish to pierce us with the poisoned arrows of their bad reasoning,üîΩare denigrating the Fortunate One,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
translated: the Blessed One.

original: 'gro ba'i bdag pos kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i gang zag gnyis te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bdag pos kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i gang zag gnyis te /
translated: The Lord of beings also said that there are two kinds of persons who slander the Tathagata.

original: ma dad pa ni zhe sdang gis so //
analyzed: ma dad pa ni zhe sdang gis so //
translated: The faithless, through hatred,

original: dad pa ni log par zin pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dad pa ni log par zin pas so zhes gsungs so //

original: rab tu byed pa chos mngon pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa chos mngon pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba rdzogs so /
